characters: CREDITS OVER A FULL SCREEN FILM REEL

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: EXT. RURAL AFGHANISTAN — DAY FROM UP HIGH: a U.S. Military convoy worms through a barr vista. ROCK MUSIC swells as we drift down and enter the center Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Airmen, kids with battle-worn faces. Crammed in the with them is a Man in an expensive suit, who looks tele- ported from Beverly Hills. He is, of course, genius inventor and billionaire, TONY STARK. In his hand is a drink tumbler of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it. You guys aren’t allowed to talk. Is that it? Are you not allowed to talk? One Airman grins, fidgeting with his orange NY Mets watch

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No. We’re allowed to talk.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. So it’s personal.

dialogues.speaker: RAMIREZ
dialogues.text: I think they’re intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Good God, you’re a woman. The others try to compress laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, honestly, I couldn’t have called that. (after silence) I would apologize, but isn’t that what we're going for here? I saw you as a soldier first.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I have a question, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 2.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Is it true you’re twelve for twelve with last years Maxim cover girls?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Excellent question. Yes and no. March and I had a schedule conflict but, thankfully, the Christmas cover was twins. Anyone else? You, with the hand up.

dialogues.speaker: PRATT
dialogues.text: It’s a little embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Join the club.

dialogues.speaker: PRATT
dialogues.text: Can I take a picture with you?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Are you aware that Native Americans believe photographs steal a little piece of your soul? (then) Not to worry, mine’s long gone. Fire away. Pratt, excited, poses as another Airman snaps the photo. second later -- A MASSIVE EXPLOSION rocks them. Through the windshield, t Humvee ahead of them erupts in a fireball. Tony is flung aside, and in the side-mirror -- The Humvee behind them EXPLODES. Pandemonium as -- The Airmen are instantly in battle mode. They scramble ou shutting Tony inside.

dialogues.speaker: STAY HERE
dialogues.text: TONY’S POV - OF JIMMY: as he’s stitched by a bouncing Bet mine. Now, running past, firing a .50 cal. machine gun is USAF Lt. Colonel JAMES “RHODEY” RHODES. He looks in.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: GET DOWN, TONY. GET THE -—- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION cuts him off. Rhodey fires through the chaos covering all directions, then advances into the murk. Another Hummer goes up in a fireball, and now -- Tony’s window blows in, spraying glass and shrapnel. He scrambles for the door. EXT. TONY’S HUMVEE - SECONDS LATER Smoke. Machine gun fire. Tracers zip past. SHOUTING. Tony ducks, scampering along. He spots an M-16, picks it but the weapon is burning hot. He drops it, moves on when Something PINGS off a smoldering Humvee and thuds in the near him. He spins and we -- SNAP ZOOM TO: an RPG, revealing its pedigree, “USM 11676 STARK MUNITIONS.” Just as we suspect it’s a dud, it DETONATES and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throws Tony back, shredding his suit and revealing his bo armor underneath. Over the chatter of SMALL ARMS FIRE we

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO WHITE
dialogues.text: INT. INSURGENT CAVE - AFGHANISTAN — DAY Tony snaps awake. He’s tied to a chair, bloody rags cover his chest. Two Insurgents flank a DV camera. Behind Tony A line of armed hooded men and a banner showing ten interlocked rings. The Leader, a huge Choori knife in one hand, reads rhetoric (in Dari) for the camera. PUSH IN ON - THE DV CAMERA VIEWFINDER: until the image of desperate Tony breaks up into pixel chaos.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS OVER A FULL SCREEN FILM REEL
dialogues.text: The attack on Pearl Harbor. FDR gives an impassioned spee NARRATOR (RHODEY’S VOICE) December 7, 1941: the day the world changed forever. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NARRATOR (RHODEY’S VOICE) (cont'd) President Roosevelt declares the United States will build fifty thousand planes to fight the armies of Hirohito and Hitler-- S.S. Officers goose-step through Paris.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Although no such capacity to build existed... 1940s L.A., an unassuming hangar reads: “STARK INDUSTRIES

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Howard Stark, founder of the fledgling Stark Industries, answers his call to duty -- A Young Howard Stark shakes FDR’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: And builds not fifty, but a hundred thousand planes. An airfield covered in B-29s. Stark bombers in flight, strewing bombs and paratroopers across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Later, Stark’s work on the Manhattan project makes the end of the war possible. A mushroom cloud in the New Mexico desert. Howard Stark observes with Oppenheimer.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Stark Industries would go on to contribute to every major weapons system through the Cold War -- Korean War, B-52s, ICBMS, nuclear subs, F-16s launching f carriers. Howard Stark with Kennedy, Johnson, Nixon.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: But Howard Stark’s greatest achievement would come in 1973-- President Ford, holding baby Tony, posing with Howard. Fo year-old Tony building a massive building-block city. How and twelve year-old Tony assembling a hot-rod engine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 5.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: From early on, it was clear that Tony Stark had a unique gift-- Tony working on TURBINE ENGINES in a hangar full of F-18s

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: At seventeen he graduated summa cum laude from MIT. Four years later, tragedy would pass the Stark mantle from father to son-- Howard’s funeral. Tony with Reagan, Bush Sr. and Clinton.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: The loss of a titan. But Tony did not let personal grief distract him from his duty -- Tony cuts the ribbon on a brand new ARK REACTOR at Stark Industries West Coast HQ.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: At twenty-one, he became the youngest-ever CEO of a Fortune 500 company. And with it came a new mandate -- A laser-guided bomb hits its target.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Smarter weapons, fewer casualties. A dedication to preserving life. A visual crescendo of America’s modern military might.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Today Tony Stark’s ingenuity continues to protect freedom and American interest around the globe. A waving American flag superimposed with an Annie Liebowi portrait of Tony. And as it fades out, APPLAUSE, then -- A light shines on a podium, revealing Lt. Colonel Rhodes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 6.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: As Program Manager and Liaison to Stark Industries, I’ve had the honor of serving with a real patriot, a man whose life has been dedicated to protecting our troops on the front lines. He’s a friend. And a great mentor. A man who has always been there for his friends and his country. Ladies and gentlemen, this year’s ARES Award winner -- Mr. Tony Stark. THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE. A spotlight fixes on Tony Stark -- o rather -- his empty chair. Applause wanes, lights fade up REVEAL: INT. BALLROOM - CAESAR’S PALACE - LAS VEGAS - NIG Military brass, politicians, movers and shakers. Heads swivel and MURMUR -- where’s Tony? OBADIAH STANE (50s), CFO of Stark Industries, regards the empty chair. He makes his way to the podium. Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Thank you...I, uhhh, I’m not Tony Stark, but if I were Tony, I'd tell you how honored I am and...what a joy it is to receive this award. (then) The best thing about Tony is also the worst thing -- he’s always working.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: ECU: tumbling red dice on a green felt. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony plays craps, a crowd erupting as they all win big. Chips pile up. Tony’s flanked on both sides by lucky ladi In between rolls, he whispers into one Woman's ear --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ..+-you think we’re having a ‘moment’ here, but this is actually the logical conclusion of several mathematical truisms. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 6A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) Your hypothalamus is flooding your system with a chain of proteins called peptides, so that every cell in your body is opening itself up to the happy chemical: oxytocin.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (seriously turned on) That’s...wow....

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hold on a second -- He rolls again. The table is hot. More cheers.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: -- so now your limbic system is positively...throbbing. A Kirlian photograph of us right now, occupying this space, would show serious subatomic particles being exchanged between us, with a rapidity that transcends-- (then) Are you getting this? You will be quizzed -- And now he sees Rhodey pulling up, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: My God, what are you, they roped you into this thing too?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. They said you’d be deeply honored if I presented.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s do it. Rhodey plops the ARES statue down on the felt.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That was quick. Thought there’d be more of, you know, a ceremony. Maybe a highlight reel -- Tony shakes karma into the dice, rolls again. He craps ou Groans from the table, everyone staring at Rhodey the “cooler”.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (to the Boxman) Colore me up. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 6B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) (turns others) My chaperone has just arrived with my -- (holding the ARES) -- Degenerate of the Year Award. Judging from his look, I may have just peed in the kiddie pool. The Boxman racks up Tony’s chips.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I must now take my ease, along with the House’s funds. He’s handed racks of chips, then tips the table Operators heads off with Rhodey. Two hotel Security Guards fall in behind. As they meander past tables -- People gawk, snap photos of Tony with their phones.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: A lot of people would kill to have their name on that award.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It belongs to my old man. They should have given it to him.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? A thousand people came here tonight to honor you, and you leave them with egg on their face. This award means something, Tony, it’s bigger than you --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hold that thought a sec. He’s stopped in front of a roulette wheel. Puts all his chips down on, nods to wheel operator.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Put it all on black. Don’t worry -- it’s approved. The Wheel Operator spins -- CLOSE ON - ROULETTE WHEEL: the ball finally settling on r The Dealer scoops away Tony’s chips.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: ...-you just blew three million. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don’t know what was more exciting -- winning it...or the fact that I don’t care I just lost it.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Everything's funny to you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No. You’re not funny.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: We've got a hell of a day tomorrow. Can we get out of here now?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: One more stop. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. 6C.

dialogues.speaker: B8
dialogues.text: c8 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty palatial bathroom. Tony’s in the stall on his throne. Rhodey splashes his face by the mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (IN STALL)
dialogues.text: Of course I respect your opinion.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: This is no joke. You're going into a hot zone. We should be doing this test here in Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (IN STALL)
dialogues.text: This system has to be demonstrated in true field conditions. The Bathroom door swings open and VIRGINIA “PEPPER” POTTS enters, Tony’s sexy and very capable assistant.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Tony, it’s the President. Wants to congratulate you personally. Heads up. She tosses the cellphone over the top of the stall. All v routine. Rhodey listens to Tony talk, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (IN STALL)
dialogues.text: ...dim, how’re the trout running? Yeah, sitting on top of the world here. Working on my masterpiece --

dialogues.speaker: A MINUTE LATER
dialogues.text: Tony washes up. As they leave, Rhodey drops money in the absent Attendant’s tip basket. Tony adds the ARES statue the basket and follows Rhodey out. INT. CASINO FLOOR - CAESAR’S PALACE —- CONTINUOUS - NIGHT Hotel Guards have patrons cordoned outside the bathroom. PICK UP Tony and Pepper in mid walk-and-talk.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You're leaving the country for a week. I need five minutes -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  c8

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay -- shoot. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 7A. c8  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 8. EXT. CAESAR’S PALACE - NIGHT Tony heads for his waiting limo, the entourage hanging ba

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (checking her tablet PC) The Board meeting is on the eleventh. Should I tell them to expect an appearance--? WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Mr. Stark! Tony turns, spots CHRISTINE EVERHART, a hot young Reporte holding a recorder. Security keeps her at bay.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Christine Everhart, Vanity Fair Magazine. Can I ask you a few questions?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Can I ask a few back? She gives him a disarming smile. Tony waves at Security t let her through. Pepper shakes her head, then takes a cal

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: You’ve been described as a Da Vinci for our times. What do you say to that?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ridiculous. I don’t paint.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: And what do you say to your other nickname: “The Merchant of Death?”

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That’s not bad -- Her gaze is suddenly cold.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Let me guess. Berkeley?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Brown. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 8A.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Well Miss Brown, it’s an imperfect world and I assure you, the day weapons are no longer needed to keep the peace, I’1ll start manufacturing bricks and beams to make baby hospitals.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Rehearse that much, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Every night in front of the mirror. Call me Tony.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, “Tony”, I was hoping for a serious answer.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Here’s serious: my old man had a philosophy: peace means having a bigger stick than the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Good line, coming from the guy selling the sticks.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: My father helped defeat Hitler. He was on the Manhattan Project. A lot of people -- including your professors at Brown -- might call that being a hero.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Others might call it war- profiteering. Tony has to smile, this gal is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Tell me: do you plan to report on the millions we've saved by advancing medical technology? Or kept from starving with our inteli- crops? All were breakthroughs spawned from, that’s right, military funding.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Wow. You ever lose an hour of sleep your whole life? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 8B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He regards her in earnest, then off her drop-dead look we

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  10 11 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 9-10. INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - STARK ESTATE - NIGHT 9 Christine and Tony, half naked, crashing about. She’s the one attacking. They flop out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 10
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - MORNING 11 A clock changing from “5:59AM” to 6:00”. Christine awaken alone, as the room begins to transform -- Darkened windows turn translucent, admitting light. She rises, startled by the TV flickering alive as she pas it. She looks out the window -- hell of a view. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  Al2 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 11.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE WINDOW
dialogues.text: As we PULL AWAY and establish Tony’s estate, perched impossibly on the cliffs above the Pacific.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. Al2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 12. INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - SAME TIME B12 Christine pads over to the closet, tries to open it.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Miss Everhart, you are not authorized to access that area. She jumps, freaked out, grabs for Tony’s shirt on the flo and covers herself. Just then -- Pepper enters, holding dry-cleaned clothes in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (re: the voice) Don’t worry, that’s Jarvis -- he runs the house. Jarvis: de- activate security. Pepper eyes Tony’s oversized shirt on Christine.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Here, your clothes cleaned and pressed. Anything else I can get you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Look, Tony wanted me to stay for breakfast, but I’ve got to get a jump on the day. Call me a cab, would you?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Cab’'s waiting outside. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: And a coffee, hon. Black. One Splenda.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (smiling sweetly) Should I tell Mr. Stark you were satisfied with the interview?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 12
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  13 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 12A. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - MORNING 13 It's like the chaos inside Tony’s head -- ultra-modern dr and missile parts, sports cars and long-abandoned prototy Framed photos of Tony and his Dad working on a classic ‘3 Ford. MUSIC drifts from an old Wurlitzer. We drift flathead Tony, in the same PDA. past: screens containing various CAD images of a engine, and finally we find -- suit-slacks and an undershirt, grimy from working on ‘32 Ford as in the photo. Pepper enters holding her

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You still owe me five minutes--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Five? I’1l need a bit longer than that --

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Focus. I need to leave on time today.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're rushing me. What, you have plans tonight?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: The MIT commencement. Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Tell me your plans.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’ll tell them ‘yes’. You want to buy the Jackson Pollock? He’s got another buyer in the wings --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What’s it look like?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s a minor work in his later Spring Period, it’s ludicrously over-priced--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Buy it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 12B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She's interrupted by her phone and taps her blue-tooth headset. Listens.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: He left an hour ago. Okay. (hangs up) It’s Rhodey again.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You have plans, don’t you --?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’m allowed to have plans on my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s your birthday again?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Yep. Funny, same day as last year.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Well, get yourself something from me. Something nice.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Already did.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: It was very tasteful, very elegant. Thank you, Mr. Stark.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're welcome, Miss Potts. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  14 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodey, in uniform, paces talking on a cellphone. Behind a parked Boeing Business Jet reading: STARK INTERNATIONAL “TOMORROW TODAY.” A GROWING RUMBLE and Rhodey turns to se A Saleen S7 roaring up, stopping short of him. Seconds la A Rolls limo arrives. Tony’s chauffeur HOGAN pops the tru and takes out: a single overnight suitcase. The Saleen’s scissor-doors open, Tony jumps out. He heads for the Boeing, right past Rhodey.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sorry, pal -- car trouble. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  15 16 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 14. INT. TONY’S PLANE - PARKED - DAY 15* Rhodey, steaming, settles into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I was standing out there three hours, what the hell --?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I had car trouble. A hot Flight Attendant holds out steamy towels with thong

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Thanks, maybe later. Rhodey grabs a towel. The WHINE of ENGINES build. INT. TONY’S PLANE - FLYING - DAY 16 A Flight Attendant stops by their seats.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Two fingers of Laphroig. (to Rhodey) You want one?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: We're working.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You should have a drink. We've got a twelve hour flight ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: It’s two in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s two in the morning where we're going. C’mon, ten hours “bottle to throttle --”

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Don’t start with me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jeez, we're not getting hammered. Just a nightcap. We’1l sleep better, arrive fresh. It’s the responsible thing to do. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) I don’t know about you, but I want to sell some weapons. Off Rhodey’s stoic look, we -- 14a. 16

dialogues.text: 16 17 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 15.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S PLANE - FLYING - NIGHT 17 MUSIC blares. Tony and Rhodey sip drinks, comfortably num and oblivious to the flight attendants dancing next to th

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: (a few drinks in) You don’t get it. I don’t work for the military because they paid for my education, or my father’s education. Don’t cheapen it like that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: All I said was, with your smarts, your engineering background, you could write your own ticket in the private sector -- on top of which, you wouldn’t have to wear that ‘straight-jacket’.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: ‘Straight-jacket’? This uniform means something. A chance to make a difference. You don’t respect that, because you don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (motions with a nod) See that one? Her I understand. Croatian. Hot-blooded, I'm serious. Must be those winters in Zagreb --

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You're not listening to a word I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I am listening. I’m changing the subject. It’s the same litany, every time you’ve had a thimble of alcohol. Drink One: reflections on the New American Century and related topics -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Something’s...seriously wrong with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Drink 2: a history of World War II and the Tuskeegee Flyers. Drink 3--

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You know, hell with you. I’m not talking to you anymore. 15A. 17 He undoes his seatbelt, rises, looking for somewhere else sit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Go hang with the pilot. You'll get along, he’s got a personality just like yours.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I will. Rhodey heads to the cockpit and opens the door. RHODEY’S POV - THE COCKPIT Two empty pilot chairs, a fully-automated flight system. As Rhodey returns to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: That’s funny.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You could tell? © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  18 19 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony exits the plane, fresh, fired up to greet the waitin brass. He shakes hands. Then -- Rhodey appears dressed in ABUs. He’s weary, squinting at stinging sun. Pulls his sunglasses down over bleary eyes. Three JERICHO MISSILES on a ‘flatbed’ (which have been unloaded from a military jet in the b.g.) are brought und heavy guard to a waiting convoy. The CHATTER of MACHINE GUN fire and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony firing a N.R.F. 425 MACHINE GUN. Generals sit on folding chairs behind a safe-zone of Hesc and sand-bags. Afghani soldiers and SF (Air Force securit men patrol the perimeter. Tony puts the N.R.F. 425 gun down next to other weapons. struts before the Generals like a carnival barker.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The age old question: is it better to be feared or respected? I say, is it too much to ask for both? He nods at the Jericho Missile, on a mobile launcher.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: With that in mind, I humbly present the crown jewel of Stark Industries Freedom Line. It’s the first missile system to incorporate my proprietary Repulsor Technology. They say the best weapon is one you never have to fire. I prefer the one you only have to fire once... The Jericho ROARS into the sky from a mobile launcher.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That’s how dad did it, it’s how America does it, and so far its worked out pretty well. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  19 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 16A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) Find an excuse to fire off one of these and I personally guarantee the enemy is not gonna want to leave their caves. FLASH TO: the Jericho, as it divides from a single missil into scores of mini-missiles.

dialogues.speaker: ON TONY
dialogues.text: A row of majestic peaks behind him. He raises his arms.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: For your consideration, the Jericho... The mountains behind his outstretched hands explode. The shock-wave washes over Tony, blanking him with dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shock-wave erases the observing Generals with dust

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Now there’s one last creation I haven’t shown anyone yet. You might be interested... He opens a large silver case. Ice-smoke curls out, then - A bottle appears. Drink glasses. As Tony pours the Genera and Afghani military officials exchange awkward glances.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (raises his glass) To peace, gentlemen...and with every five hundred million, I'1l throw in a free one of these... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  19 20 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Generals board their Humvees and depart to the East. Tony and Rhodey walk to their convoy of waiting Humvees, pointing West. Tony gets Obadiah Stane on his video-phone

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Sleeping. How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I think we got an early Christmas coming.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey, why aren’t you wearing the PJs I got you?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: I don’t do monograms. I’m hanging up now, bye-bye. Stane hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: All right, who wants to ride with me? Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (psyched) Me? Jazzed, Jimmy and the others jump into the lead Humvee. A Rhodey approaches --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Rhodey, no room for my conscience in here. Or that hang- dog look. (raising his glass) See you back at base. Rhodey shakes his head, and heads for a different Humvee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  20 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 17A.

dialogues.text: ROCK MUSIC is cranked up on a boom-box. And as Tony’s doo slams shut --

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightmarish. GARBLED VOICES. Stabbing lights. Tony thrashes against a restraining belt. Impressionistic glimpses: a red scalpel. Blood-spattered hands. Tony’s heaving chest. A boilerplate. TONY'S POV: YINSEN (60s), looks down on us, performing th “operation”. He yells to someone in Arabic, and -- Tony is held down, a chloroform rag is pressed to his fac © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  22 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony flickers awake, disoriented. A tube protrudes from h nose. He sees -- Yinsen, humming a tune as he shaves by a broken mirror. B more importantly right now -- There is a jug of water on the table. Tony tries to speak, can’t. It’s the damn nasal tube. He pulls at it, gagging as two of feet of tubing slithers fr his nose.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) .--water...water. Yinsen keeps humming. Tony yanks the IV from his arm and stretches for the water, but is stopped by -- A wire, under his chest bandages, snapping taut.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that if I were you. Tony follows the wire with his eyes and finds, to his hor that it’s hooked up to a car battery. He starts clawing at his chest bandages. Yinsen turns. Tony sees his ugly chest wound. It’s too much. He swoons. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yinsen stirs a bubbling pot on the furnace. He flicks glances at Tony, waking up on the cot. Tony eyes the bulky chest-piece protruding from his fresh bandages.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What have you done to me?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: What did I do? I removed what I could, but there’s a lot left headed for you atrial septum. Do you want a souvenir? He tosses Tony a jar with scores of bloody Christmas tree like barbs. Tony regards the ‘shrapnel’ he owns the paten to, and lets the jar drop.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I’ve seen many wounds like this in my village. The walking dead we called them, because it took a week for the barbs to reach vital organs. I anchored a magnetic suspension system to the plate. It’s holding the shrapnel in place...at least for now. Tony struggles up, sits on the cot and notices something TONY’S POV: a surveillance camera on the cave wall.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: That's right, smile. (then) We met once -- at a technical conference in Bern.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I don’t remember.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t. If I’d been that drunk, I wouldn’t have been able to stand, much less give a talk on integrated circuits.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Where are we --? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door-slat flies opens and a pair of dark eyes stare i Yinsen drops his spoon, puts his hands on his head.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Stand up! Do as I do. Now! Tony gets to his feet, can’t gets his hands up. Yinsen he him.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Listen to me, whatever they ask you, refuse. You understand? You must refuse. The door opens and ABU BAKAR enters with two armed Henchm (Ahmed and Omar). On Ahmed’s wrist, Tony notices -- Jimmy's bright orange METS watch (from the convoy earlier

dialogues.speaker: ABU
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Welcome Tony Stark, the greatest mass murderer in the history of America. It’s a great honor.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (translating for Abu) He says welcome Tony Stark, the greatest mass murderer in the history of America. He is very honored. Abu looks Tony up and down like a prize horse, then --

dialogues.speaker: ABU
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) I want you to build this for me -- the Jericho missile you were demonstrating. Abu holds out a photo: a surveillance image of the Jerich Missile launch.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (translation) You will build for him Jericho missile you were demonstrating.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ...I refuse. Yinsen backhands Tony across the face, goes ballistic -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: C23
dialogues.text: 23 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 20B.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: You refuse? You will do everything he says. This is the great Abu Bakar. You're alive only because of his generosity. You are nothing. NOTHING. He offers you his hospitality, and you answer only with insolence He will not be refused. You will die in a pool of your own blood. Abu, spooning down Yinsen’s food, throws a look of smug satisfaction. He heads out. The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Perfect. You did very well, Stark. Tony is utterly perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Good, I think they’re starting to trust me. Yinsen returns to cooking.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s the end of my plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony is jostled awake by Abu’s Henchmen, wrestling a hood over his head. He struggles as he’s pulled to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY’S POV - THROUGH HOOD: approaching the tunnel opening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - TONY: the hood is yanked off his head. He squi into the stinging daylight, his expression turning to sho In a bowl of tall mountains, camouflaged tarps are furled revealing skids upon skids of Stark Industries weapons da back to 80s Afghanistan. VARIOUS SHOTS - OF CRATES: the STARK INTERNATIONAL MUNITI logos. Some faded, some new. Tony, stunned, staggers along the crates. Yinsen follows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  23

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: How did they get all this?

dialogues.speaker: ABU YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) (translation) As you see, we have As you can see, they have everything you need to build everything you need to build the Jericho. You will make a the Jericho. He says make a list of materials and start list of materials. You will work right away. When we are start work right away and done we will set you free. when you are done he will set you free. Tony sees a heavily armed and imposing man surrounded by several men, who act as pilot fish around him. This is Warlord RAZA, a man you don’t mess with.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No he won't

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: +-.no he won’t.

dialogues.text: Cold charred wreckage. Rhodey, GENERAL GABRIEL (50s) and team of SF men assess the remains of Tony’s convoy.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Something’s not right.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Looks like a standard hit and run.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Sir, I’m telling you, this was a snatch and grab. A perfectly executed linear ambush. As soon as they got what they wanted, they melted away.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Intel’s on it, we’re in good hands. If he’s out there, we’1ll get him. It hangs there, then -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: With your permission I’d like to stay in theater and head up the search and investigation.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: There's a PR firestorm brewing over this. Right now the best way to serve your country is to get back there and handle it.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Tony Stark is the DOD’s number one intellectual asset, and I can be of value in the field.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Duly noted, but we need you back home. (walks away, then) Colonel, it’s not lost on me that Stark is a lifelong friend. Rhodey nods and heads for his Humvee as things are packed

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  24 25 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Tony sits in a wheelbarrow by the furnace, wrapped an Army surplus blanket. Yinsen looms over him. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I’m sure they’re looking for you, Stark, but they will never find you here. (then) That car battery is running out...and they won’t turn on the generator till you start to work.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: You don’t like what you saw out there, did you? I didn’t like it either when those weapons destroyed my village. (beat) What you just saw, that’s your legacy -- your life’s work in the hands of these murderers. Is that how you want to go out? Is this the last act of defiance of the great Tony Stark? Or are you going to try to do something about it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why should I do anything, they’re either going to kill me or I’m going to die in a week.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Then this is a very important week for you. 25 © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 22.

dialogues.text: The lights come on as the generator is started. Abu is flanked by Ahmed and several Guards. He watches as -- Omar refuels the generator, then walks the gas can to -- A ‘cage’, housing a fuel drum, and locks that down too.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay, here’s what I need... Tony paces, barking what he needs done while more of Abu’ Guards carry in missiles and materials. Yinsen follows, translating as Tony assesses his work area.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: S-Category missiles. Lot 7043. The S-30 explosive tritonal. And a dozen of the S-76. Mortars: M-Category #1, 4, 8, 20, and 60. M- 229's, I need eleven of these. Mines: the pre-90s AP 5s and AP l6s. Abu’s men dart about.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ...this area free of clutter, with good light. I want it at 12 o'clock to the door to avoid logjams. I need welding gear -- acetelyene or propane, helmets, a soldering set-up with goggles, and smelting cups. Two full sets of precision tools.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) S-Category missiles. Lot 7043. The S-30 explosive tritonal. And a dozen of the S-76. Mortars: M-Category #1, 4, 8, 20, and 60. M- 229's, he needs eleven of these. Mines: the pre-90s AP 5s and AP l6s.

He needs welding gear -- acetylene or propane, helmets, a soldering set-up with goggles, and smelting cups. Two full sets of precision tools. Abu getting exasperated by the never-ending list. (thinks, then) tea, and some playing cards. And a washing machine. Top (pauses) And a washing load. machine. Top load. Abu’s eye bulge. He gets in Tony’s face.

dialogues.text: (in Arabic)

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (to Abu) Must have everything. Great Satan make big boom-kill for powerful Abu Bakar. Big boom-kill.

dialogues.text: INT. LAB - CAVE — NEXT DAY - DAY D32 Tony pulls open a missile-housing and removes a glass rin from the inner workings of its guts. Then -- He leads Yinsen up to a large missile crate. They remove chip-rack cylinder from a larger warhead.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: You do know they’ve removed all the explosives before they brought this to us.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know, they’re crazy not stupid. Tony walks the heavy chip-rack to the work-bench and remo a tiny palladium strip.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This is what we’re looking for. I need eleven of these. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Eleven?

dialogues.speaker: E32
dialogues.text: SHOT OF: Yinsen removes chip-rack cylinders, bringing the Tony. Tony extracts palladium strips.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Heat the palladium to 1825 Kelvin.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (at furnace) How will I know when it reaches that temperature?

dialogues.speaker: TONY

dialogues.text: INSERT OF: Tony wraps a copper coil around the glass ring INSERT OF: Tony drops palladium strips into a crucible on fire. INSERT OF: Tony sculpts a sand-mold for the palladium rin

dialogues.text: Careful, careful...

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Relax. I always had steady hands. It's why you’re still alive.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, thanks. What do I call you?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: My name is Yinsen.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you too. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: What are you building?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: A better mousetrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony plugs a cable into the generator.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What are you shaving for? We’re almost done.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (taking his time shaving) Look like an animal, and soon you'll start behaving like one. Tony throws a generator switch. The lights go up and down INSERT SHOT OF: the finished RT device, wired to the generator cable, beginning to glow on the workbench. Yinsen wipes his face, and trails Tony to the workbench. undoes the wires, holding up the glowing RT device.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: That doesn’t look like a Jericho missile.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That’s because it’s a miniature ARK reactor. It should suspend the shrapnel in my chest and keep it from entering my heart.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: What an original invention. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: K32

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this one is going to last a bit longer than a week.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: It’s pretty small, what can it generate?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Three gigajoules -- per second. Yinsen marvels.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: That could run your heart for fifty lifetimes.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Or something very big for fifteen minutes. Their eyes meet a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Let’s put it in. INT. RAZA’S CONTROL ROOM - CAVE - HOURS LATER - DAY J32 PUSH IN - MONITOR: Tony lying on a workbench, Yinsen cran over him. PUSH IN - ON: Raza, watching as he spoons peanut-butter f a military airdrop care-package.

dialogues.text: Sorry, did I startle you?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: A little... He watches as Pepper swaps yesterday’s unread L.A. Times Wall Street Journal with today’s. Her little vigil. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Stane rises, gazes out the windows at the vast Stark compound. Pepper comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: This was a bad idea, I should never have let him go over there... He starts to break down. She touches his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Hey, hey...we’ve got to be strong, he’s going to be okay. He composes himself, nods.

He snuffs the torch, look over his shoulder at -- Yinsen concentrating on building a backgammon board. Tony secretly begins filling a cylinder with gas from the torch.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (flicks a glance at Tony) Stark, tell me what you’re doing, and I‘’11 tell you what I’m doing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Looks to me like you’re making a crappy backgammon board.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Is that where you’re from, Lebanon? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I'm impressed you even know what this is. (then) How about we play, and if I win, you tell me what you're really making.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: “A" I don’t know what your talking about. “B” I was the backgammon champ at MIT four years running.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Interesting, I was the champion at Cambridge.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Please don’t use ‘interesting’ and Cambridge in the same sentence. (then) Is that still a school?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: It’s a university. You probably haven’t heard about it since Americans can’t get in.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Unless they’re teaching. The door-slat flies open. Abu again. He barks, more stern than usual. Tony stops, the secret cylinder he was fillin clatters to the floor. Yinsen notices, looks at Tony. Abu, Ahmed and Omar enter, followed by RAZA’S GUARDS. The take up positions, rigid. Raza enters (he speaks English)

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Relax. They lower their hands. Silence as Raza meanders, picking and putting things down. He almost steps on Tony’s secret cylinder, but then sees the washing machine. He shoots Ab cold look and turns to the workbench and -- Peruses Tony’s onion-paper schematics of the missile.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: The bow and arrow was once the pinnacle of weapons technology. It allowed the great Genghis Khan to rule from the Pacific to the Ukraine. He pushes the schematics around trying to make sense of t (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 26-27G.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Today...whoever has the latest Stark weapons rules these lands. Soon it will be my turn... A beat as Raza looks back and forth between Yinsen and To

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (to Yinsen in Urdu) What’s really going on here?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) Nothing. We're working.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) It’s been a long time. Where’s the weapon?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) He’s working very hard. It’s very complex. Yinsen flicks a glance at Tony, who watches apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (to Abu, in Urdu) Get him on his knees. Yinsen is forced to his knees by Abu and Ahmed. Using ton Raza lifts a hot coal from the furnace and approaches Yin

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) Tell me what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) Nothing! NOTHING is going on.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: OPEN YOUR MOUTH
dialogues.text: Yinsen won't do it. Abu and Ahmed force his mouth open. CLOSE ON - COAL: heading for Yinsen’s mouth. He struggles

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (in Urdu)

dialogues.speaker: TELL ME NOW
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  33 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 26-27H.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Urdu) He’s building your bomb. The glowing coal nearly at Yinsen’s mouth now....then -- Raza drops the coal on the floor in front of Yinsen and leaves. Raza’s men follow and slam the door shut. Yinsen gathers himself, then --

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: That’s twice I saved your life. Now are you going to tell me what the hell you’re really building? Their eyes hold, then --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Finally, an idea of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Abu in a tunnel, heading for the lab. He shoves the door-slat aside. ABU’S POV - THROUGH SLAT: Tony, shaving in front of the broken mirror, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abu shuts the door slat. Tony wipes his face, pulls on a pair of gloves as he goes the furnace. He takes a white-hot piece of metal from the forge and starts pounding on it. Yinsen, soldering a complex circuit, looks up. He is stru by the image of Tony, strong and resolute, hammering away SLOWLY PUSH IN ON - TONY: hammering away.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My people have a tale, about a Prince -- much hated by his King -- who was banished to the underworld and jailed there... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 28A.

dialogues.speaker: F36 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOOM! BOOM! The hammer blows ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The evil King gave him the most difficult labor -- working the iron pits. Tony’s muscles ripple, sweat flying.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Year after year the Prince mined the heavy ore, becoming so strong he could crush pieces of it together with his bare hands. Too late, the King realized his mistake... Dazzling sparks fly around Tony.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When he struck at the Prince with his finest sword -- it broke in half. The Prince himself had become strong as iron... Tony, sweating, holds up the metal he’s been working on - A crude iron mask stares back. He tosses the mask down. It lies there smoking and pulsin with heat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 29.

dialogues.speaker: F36 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  36 37 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From down the hallway, Pepper watches Obadiah and Rhodey close, heavy conversation. Obadiah, grave, looks over and catches Pepper’s eye, then he walks off, shaking his head Rhodey on his way out. Pepper steps into his path.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: So that’s it? Everyone’s pulling the plug and moving on...

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing left we can do. If there was any indication Tony was still alive--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Spare me. I read the official e- mail. Thought maybe you'd have something different to say. Rhodey follows her into --

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: If anyone could figure out how to beat the odds, it’s Tony. If it was you over there, he’d be finding a way to get you back. Or inventing a new one.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Be a better friend to him. And with that, she storms out, leaving him stung. EXT. EDWARDS A.F.B. — DAY BA39 Rhodey, duffel slung in front of a C-17, is shipping out line of soldiers. General Gabriel pulls up on a golf cart and approaches. Everyone salutes. The General pulls Rhode aside. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GABRIEL
dialogues.text: What do you think you’re doing, Rhodes?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Going back there, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Listen, son -- it’s been three months without a single indication that Stark is still alive. We can’t keep risking assets, least of all you.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Are you blocking my transfer, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (looking around) Any one of these guys would kill for your career. Are you telling me you're willing to sacrifice that to fly a bunch of snake-eaters on a desert patrol half way around the world?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I am, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Then I have one thing to say to you: Godspeed. He salutes Rhodey. Rhodey salutes back.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GABRIEL
dialogues.text: (to the soldiers) As you were. Rhodey turns and heads up the ramp into the loading bay.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.text: Tony puts the finishing touches on a strange box housing laser-pointer, fan and tinsel. He tapes the box shut, pee through a tiny hole in its side. TONY’S POV - INTO BOX: it looks like the furnace flames i the dark. INT. RAZA’S CONTROL ROOM - NIGHT B39 Guards, bored and tired mill about. CLOSE ON - SURVEILLANCE MONITOR: which shows the furnace glowing in the dark lab. There is a brief shift in the image, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strange box Tony was working on is being affixed over surveillance camera.

dialogues.text: A work-light is on, revealing Tony and Yinsen by the workbench. A sensor on Tony’s leg is coupled to a contraption. Yinsen watches intently as -- Tony plugs a wire into his RT ‘heart’, a moment as -- Data races up on the crusty laptop...then -- As Tony moves his leg, the contraption on the table sprin to life, responding to his actions. Tony’s chest-device, which dims with the power loss. The two men’s eyes drift up and hold. Triumph.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (unplugging himself) We're ready. A week of assembly and we’re a go.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Then perhaps it’s time we settle another matter... © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 31a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and Yinsen eat and play backgammon.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Ah, anchoring with 13-7. You know, I have never met anyone who understands the nuances of this game like you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Right back at ya.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You never told me where you're from. A moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I come from a small village not far from here. It was a good place... before these men ravaged it.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Do you have a family?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: When I get out of here, I am going to see them again. (then) Do you have family, Stark?

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: You’re a man who has everything and nothing. Abu shouts from the door slat and enters.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Your laundry’s over there. Abu goes to a basket where his laundry is neatly folded. smells it, ‘ah, clean clothes.’ He heads for the door, shaking his head as he sees them play backgammon.

dialogues.speaker: ABU
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) You idiots don’t know what you’re doing with that game. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  40 4l 42

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah-yeah, enjoy your laundry. Abu is about to head out when Raza enters. Abu freezes. Raza eyes’s dip to the laundry, then without warning -- He shoots Abu in the head. Tony and Yinsen stand there, stock-still.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: You have till tomorrow to assemble my missile. He walks out. His henchmen grab Abu’s legs and drag him o The silence hangs there, then -- OMITTED 4l

Troubled he leans in, staring intently. CLOSE - ON MONITOR: Yinsen still going like hell behind t jig.

dialogues.text: (in Urdu) Khalid. Where is Stark? He taps the monitor. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  43 44 45 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 31c.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: No, they’re moving. Very slow. We glimpse a bulky chest piece being lowered over Tony. T STACCATO WHINE of PNEUMATIC TOOL as Yinsen seals Tony in. INT. RAZA’S CONTROL ROOM - MINUTES LATER - DAY 48 Raza, at his monitors, orchestrating his men over the rad

dialogues.text: Yinsen eyes the laptop, the bars creeping ever so slowly. turns, listening to the SHOUTING MEN outside growing loud

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Get to your cover. Remember the checkpoints -- make sure each one is clear before you follow me out. A decision, then Yinsen runs out.

dialogues.text: Yinsen grabs dead Khalid’s weapon and runs into the tunne firing in the air. YINSEN’S POV: rounding a corner, encountering Raza’s men. He opens fire -- the men are caught off guard, and retrea Yinsen chases, firing madly, unleashing pent-up rage. He enters the outer cavern, and is confronted by Raza and troops. Yinsen lowers his weapon to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY'S POV: trapped in the suit, watches the loading bars the laptop get close. Suddenly -- Multiple BURSTS of gunfire. Tony throws a look. SILENCE.

dialogues.text: Raza’s Guards, running at us, shouting.

dialogues.text: The loading bars on the laptop finish their cycle and -- A surge of power to the suit dims the lights.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE LAB
dialogues.text: The lights dim to darkness. Raza’s Guards, scared, inch u on the lab. Two of them break off and move forward --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LAB 54
dialogues.text: The two Guards enter the dark, smoky lab cautiously. It appears deserted. Then, a Guard stops, turns slowly -- In the dark, an eerie glow, twin-flames. The SCREAM of surging METAL and we --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE LAB 55
dialogues.text: As the two Insurgents SCREAM and are flung back out. The other Guards fire wildly into the lab. As they re-loa The THUMP and SCREECH of METAL. A glowing chest plate. Th flicker of blue pilot lights, and finally, out of the smo the complete nightmare vision -- Iron Man -- the Original Gray Armor. The Insurgents backpedal, firing, but Tony keeps coming, CRUNCHING on the cave floor. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  56 57 58 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 34. INT. RAZA’S CONTROL ROOM - DAY 56 Raza strapping on his flak vest, grabbing an RPG launcher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazy streak of tracers, bouncing off Tony. An Insurgent jumps from a side-corridor, firing his pisto point-blank at the back of Iron Man’s head. PING! The bullet ricochets back, killing the man instantl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Iron Man clumps towards the light of freedom, insurgen spill out of nooks, in front of him, behind him, firing - Tony’s arms swivel, knocking Guards down, absorbing count rounds. The suit is shredding, smoking, pockmarked.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA 58
dialogues.text: heading down a tunnel with an RPG. A wounded Guard grabs onto him, jabbering. Raza shoves him aside.
