dialogues.speaker: TONY 59
dialogues.text: turns into the main chamber and sees Yinsen on the ground

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Tony stops and an RPG whizzes past his nose, exploding in wall next to him. He turns, sees -- Raza, in the intersecting tunnel, calmly loading another Tony primes his flame throwers, but they malfunction. Bot men square off. Raza aims, but now Tony’s flame throwers kick in and -- Raza flattens as twin-plumes of fire envelope him. He SCREAMS, grabbing a dead soldiers as a shield. Tony turns clearing Insurgents out of the tunnels with hi flame throwers. Then he returns to Yinsen.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We could’ve made it. Both of us. You could've seen your family again.

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: I am going to see them again. They're waiting for me. And now Tony understands -- Yinsen’s family is dead. Yins grins, then sags into himself, dead. Rage overtakes Tony. He steams towards the exit, roaring. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  60 61 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raza’s men fleeing as a deluge of flame shoots from the tunnel. Then -- Tony emerges, the gray armor scarred and sizzling. Insurgents keep firing, trying to draw him from -- The massive ammo dump under the camouflage. But Tony is relentless, keeps moving towards it. Tony turns his flame throwers on the crates. They begin t burn -- the STARK logos eaten by flames. And now -- A withering barrage of gunfire knocks Tony to his knees. hose to his flame thrower is pierced, setting his arm on fire. Another bullet catches a seam and enters his should But Tony struggles back to his feet. The suit GRINDS. He pushes further into the maze, torching everything. More gunfire pings and ricochets off him, pieces of the g armor begins to come loose. Now -- Tony opens a metal flap on his arm, flips a red switch. A now something incredible happens -- A WHINE builds to a ROAR. Tony tucks, angles forward as - Heel-boosters glow white hot, kicking up desert plumes -- then he blasts off like a missile, rising hundreds of fee One Insurgent watches dumbstruck, as Tony arcs across the towards a mountain pass. And then -- The first ammo dump ignites. Then another and another, fi roses joining in a hellish conflagration. And barely outpacing the fireball --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gray armor shoots towards us. Tony clears the mountai ridge by inches, and then -- His boosters are suddenly spent. He plunges like a human cannonball. TONY'S POV - THROUGH SUIT: the Earth swelling up at us an © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  62 63 64 65 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony THUDS into the sand, pieces of the armor splitting a Dazed, he struggles from the exo-skeleton. He staggers in the dunes, away from the smoke and DISTANT EXPLOSIONS. He’s torn up, clutching a bullet wound. He falls, gets up again, keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony staggers down a dune, dying from thirst. Behind him A USAF Blackhawk suddenly rises over the lip of the dune. Tony turns, falling over. Moments later -- Rhodey, winded, appears over us. A grin forming.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Saving your ass is getting to be a full time job. EXT. EDWARDS A.F.B. — DAY 64 In the heat shimmers, a hulking form becomes a taxiing C-

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: The rear ramp of the C-17 comes down. Light blinds Rhodey and Tony -- who's in a wheelchair. TONY'S POV: Pepper is revealed as the ramp lands. Rhodey wheels him down. As they reach the ramp’s end--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Help me out of this thing-- He struggles to his feet, faltering. Rhodey steadies him.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I got you, pal. They walk together as Pepper comes forward. She meets eye with Rhodey, and he nods to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 39.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Thank you. And now she faces Tony. A ghost of his former self, but s puts on a brave face.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (managing a smile) Your eyes are red. A few tears for your long-lost boss?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Tears of joy. I hate job hunting. Hogan comes around, holds the limo door open for Tony.

dialogues.speaker: HOGAN
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You do something new with your hair?

dialogues.speaker: HOGAN
dialogues.text: Wouldn't dream of it, Sir. Pepper helps Tony into the limo. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence. Pepper meets eyes with Hogan in the mirr

dialogues.speaker: HOGAN
dialogues.text: Where to, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: We're due at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No -- to the office. (then) I’ve been in captivity for three months. There’s only two things I want to do. I want to eat a cheeseburger. And I want to hold a press conference. Off Pepper’s stunned look--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony’s limo pulls up, Hogan lets Tony out. He finishes a cheeseburger and Hogan takes the wrappers. Obadiah is waiting there with a group of gathered employe They all start applauding. Obadiah with arms outstretched

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: See this. Huh. Huh. He hugs Tony warmly, speaks close.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Tony, thought we were meeting at the hospital. You know there’s a lot of reporters in there. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You’ll see. C’mon -- They head inside.

dialogues.speaker: A70 OMITTED A70
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  69 70 71 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with Reporters waiting for the hundred-carat headl Pepper is approached by AGENT PHIL COULSON (40s).

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You'll have to take a seat, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m not a reporter. I’m Agent Phil Coulson with the Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: That’s a mouthful.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: I know. Here. He hands her a card. She squints at the tiny font.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Coulson, we’ve already spoken with the D.O.D., the FBI, the CIA--

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: We're a separate division with a more...specific focus. We need to debrief Tony about the circumstances of his escape. More importantly--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Well, great, I’11 let him know--

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: --we’re here to help. We’re here to listen. I assure you Mr. Stark will want to talk to us. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 41. 69 70 71 72 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 41a.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’m sure he will. Now if you could just take your seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tony enters, struggling his way to the podium, followe Obadiah. Tony gazes out over the reporters. Suddenly he seems vulnerable, scattered. The silence grows awkward. Obadiah is mercifully going to save him when --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I...can’t do this anymore. Pregnant silence. Everyone waiting for the Stark punch-li Finally, a Reporter ventures --

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You mean you're retiring?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No, I don’t want to retire. I want to do something else. The room waits through more awkward silence, then --

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Something besides weapons?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes. That’s right. The room is suddenly BUZZING with overlapping questions -

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: The official report was sketchy. What happened to you over there, Mr. Stark? Tony is pensive, then the floodgates open.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What happened over there? I had my eyes opened, that’s what happened. I saw my weapons, with my name on them, in the hands of thugs. I thought we were doing good here...I can’t say that anymore. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  72 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 41B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rhodey, just arriving in the rear, pulls up to Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Uhh, weren't we taking him to the hospital? Pepper is transfixed. Nearby, Agent Coulson watches stoically.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: What do you intend to do about it, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The system is broken -- there’s no accountability whatsoever. Right now, as of this second, we are freezing the sale of all Stark weaponry worldwide. Now the room is in chaos. Obadiah’s ready to wrap this up and moves towards Tony.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We've lost our way. I need to re- evaluate things. And my heart’s telling me I have more to offer the planet than things that blow up.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So you're saying...what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (arm around Stane) In the coming months, Mr. Stane here and I will set a new course for Stark Industries. “Tomorrow Today” has always been our slogan. It’s time we try to live up to it. The questions are now firing in a CACOPHONY. Obadiah take the podium.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Okay, I think we’re going to be selling a lot of newspapers here. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 41c.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OBADIAH (cont'd) What we should take away from this is that Tony’s back, he’s healthier than ever, and as soon as he heals up and takes some time off, we’re going to have a little internal discussion and get back to you. Thank you for coming by. Tony steps down, exhilarated. He works his way through th swarming reporters, approaching Rhodey and Pepper -- who stunned looks on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You mean that? Or is this some clever stock-maneuver?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Wait and see. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stane approaches Tony, who stares at the Arc Reactor whil eating fries and sipping a Coke.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Well that went well. You just painted targets on our heads. Our stock is going to take a 40 point dive tomorrow. Tony says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (considers a new tact) Tony, we are a weapons manufacturer. Turning this company around to make baby bottles is like trying to get a bear to walk on its hind legs.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I don’t want a body count to be my only legacy. There are other things we can do.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We could develop the Arc Reactor. Obadiah points to the Arc.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: This? This was a publicity stunt. It’s not even cost effective. We knew that before we built it. Repulsor technology is a dead end. Tony rips open his shirt, revealing the glowing RT.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No it isn’t.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: (touching the RT) Oh my God. It is a miracle you are alive. What must have happened to you over there? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OBADIAH (cont'd) (hugs Tony) We're a team. There is nothing we can’t do if we stick together -- like your father and I. Let me handle this. But you have to lay low. Don’t talk to the press again. Can you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes. Thanks Obie. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 74
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT AT75 As Tony enters, the house comes alive. Windows and lights change colors. The TV turns on. Jarvis loading all of Tony’s preferences. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 45.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Stark.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hello, Jarvis.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ...-I need to build a better heart.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I follow, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Give me a scan and you'll see. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - NIGHT 75 Tony, shirtless and wearing goggles, sits in the 3D laser scanner. Lasers play over him, mapping his entire body.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: What were your intentions for this device? MONITORS: terabytes of data race past.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It powers an electromagnet which keeps the shrapnel from entering my heart. Can you recommend any ugrades?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: It is difficult to offer counsel in light of the fact that your stated intentions are inconsistent with your actions. MONITOR: Tony’s chest device magnified. Its various components flashing as Jarvis analyzes them.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? That is ridiculous. That is exactly the purpose of this invention. MONITORS: going deeper and deeper through the strata of Tony’s device. Like it’s a city unto itself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 45a.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: The energy yeild of this device outperforms your stated intention by eleven orders of magnitude. You could accomplish your stated goal with the power output of a car battery. Tony steps from the booth. All around him, calculations flash at blinding speed.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Upgrade recommendations. List.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Why are you talking to me like a computer?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Because you are acting like one.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Shall I disable random pattern conversation?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No. It’s ok. You are the only one who understands me.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: I don’t understand you sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Were you always this dry? I remember you having more personality than this.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Should I activate sarcasm harmonics?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Fine. Could you please make your recommendations now?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: It would thrill me to no end.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ahh that’s more like it.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: Should I begin machining the parts? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  75 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 45B.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Machine away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony loads raw metal stock onto a lathe and begins cuttin A robot arm organizes pieces of cut stock. The CNC Machine comes to life and begins milling parts. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  76 77 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metal fingers protrude from the sand. A filthy human hand reaches into frame, freeing a metal gauntlet from the des floor. Then, we reveal -- Horses and old pickups, scattered as men scavenge among t dunes. A Toyota pickup flies the banner of the Ten Rings. burly man, his back to us, leans on the bed-mounted machi gun. As we TRACK around him we can see it’s -- Raza, his terrible scars still raw from Iron Man’s flame- thrower. He swats flies from his wounds. In one hand -- Raza holds Tony’s battered helmet, staring into its eyele (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  77 78

dialogues.speaker: B79
dialogues.text: 79 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Keep looking. I want all of it.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED A79
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - DAY B79 Knocks on the door, enters. The bed is untouched. The flatscreen TV is on -- Jim Cramer delivering a sermon.

dialogues.speaker: CRAMER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Stark International: I’ve got one recommendation. Ready? SEELLLL! Abandon ship! Does the Hindenburg ring any bells? Cramer pushes one of his big red buttons, and we hear the sounds of SHRIEKING. Pepper shuts it off as she talks on phone and heads out to... INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS - DAY 79 Pepper clicks on her headset.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello. This is Agent Coulson with Strategic Homeland Inter-

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Yes. I remember. What can I do for you? INTERCUT - PHIL COULSON’S OFFICE - SAME TIME A plain government-issue office. On his desk, newspapers with headlines: “STARK RAVING MAD?” “STARK LUNACY”.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: I’ve left a number of messages trying to get something on the books with Mr. Stark. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47A.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I know this is a priority for him. The next few weeks are a bit up in the air and I can’t set appointments without speaking with him first.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Do you know when you will be speaking with him again?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Not Sure. INTERCUT - TONY’S LIVING ROOM - SAME TIME Pepper is interrupted by the intercom. It’s Tony--

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pepper? How big are your hands?

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Agent Coulson, I really have to go. Let me get back to you later. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (then to the vox) What?

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How big are your hands?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t under--

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- just get down here. 80 INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - SECONDS LATER - DAY 80 Dim and unsettling. She finds Tony shirtless in a chair, sees his chest device for the first time and steels herse

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Show me your hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  80

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She does. SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47B. 80

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Just show me your hands.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perfect, they’re small. I need you to help me.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (re: heart) So that’s the thing that’s keeping you alive.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's the thing that was keeping me alive. It is now an antique. This is what will be keeping me alive for the foreseeable future. He hold up the newly fabricated, higher tech replacement chest piece.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m going to swap them out and switch all functions to the new unit.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Completely. First I need you to reach in and--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (off-put) Reach in to where?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The socket.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: What socket? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  80

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47c.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The chest socket. Listen carefully, because we have to do this ina matter of minutes.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Or else what?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I can go into cardiac arrest.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I thought you said it was safe.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I didn’t want you to panic.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Stay with me. I need you to relieve the pressure on my myocardial nerve.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to do that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m telling you.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Listen. I’m going to lift off the old chest piece--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Won’t that make you die?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Not immediately. When I lift it off I need you to reach into the socket as far as your hand can fit and gently move the housing away from my heart. Do you know which direction that is?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: To the right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  80 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47D.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: To my right. Your left.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: To the left.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Left.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Right. Left. Pepper begins to reach in.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: How deep does this go?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Keep going. She reaches uncomfortably deep.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s it. Deeper. Now press. Yes. It’s releasing. She pulls her hand out covered in a nasty pink slime.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Ew!!! Pus!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s not pus. It’s an inorganic plasmic discharge. It’s from the device, not my body.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Well it smells. Am I done?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Can I wash my hands now? She walks to the sink as Tony drops a drain into the open (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  80

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: The new unit is much more efficient. This shouldn’t happen again.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Good, cause it’s not in my job description.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It is now.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose you want to go over things? The robot arm sets in the new heart piece.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Can it at least wait until I install my new untested ground- breaking self-contained power source and lifesaving device prototype?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I suppose. She examines the old chest piece.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Throw that thing out.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to save it?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why? It’s antiquated.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You made it out of spare parts ina dungeon. It saved your life. Doesn't it at least have some nostalgic value?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pepper. I have been called many things. Nostalgic is not one of them. The new chest lights brightly. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 47E. 80 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 47F.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. Good as new. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Can I ask you a favor?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t do well under that kind of pressure. If you need someone to do something like that again, get somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I don’t have anyone else. They share a rare moment without words. A smile?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Will that be all, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That will be all, Ms. Potts. She exits. He watches, then stands up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  81 82

dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - DAYS LATER - DAY A83 Sketches and diagrams splayed on the worktable. Tony fini soldering work on two sculpted metal boots. Monitors flic behind him, the robot arm “looks” over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Still having trouble walking, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: These aren't for walking.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Tony, finishes marking a ‘test circle’ with pieces of tap He’s now wearing the boots, wired to a chest ‘bandolier’. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ready to record the big moment, Jarvis?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS
dialogues.text: All sensors ready, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We'll start off easy. Ten percent. Tony activates hand-controlled joysticks. He shoots up, flips over and out of frame. Crashes. After a beat--

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That flight yielded excellent data, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Great. I, uhh, think I know what this needs. INT. HANGAR - EDWARDS A.F.B. — DAY BA83 Rhodey paces before an F-22 and a Global Hawk drone. Stud Pilots are assembled before him.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Manned or unmanned, which is the future of air combat? For my money, no drone, no computer will ever trump a pilot’s instincts. His reflexes, his judgement-- A VOICE chimes in from the depths--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why not take it a step further?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony’s been watching from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why not...a pilot without the plane?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: That I'd like to see. (then) Look who fell out of the sky... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 S1A.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (to the pilots) Who wants to take these apart and put them back together?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: (to the pilots) All right -- let’s wrap it up. Tony walks to Rhodey as the pilots trickle out, buzzing a stealing looks at Tony.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I’d be seeing you for a while.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Figured you’d need a little time.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Why does everybody think I need time?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You’ve been through a lot, thought you should get your head straight.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I've got it straight. And I’m back to work.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m onto something big. I want you to be a part of it.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Lot of people around here will be happy to hear that. What you said at that press conference really threw everyone.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I mean what I said.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: No you don’t. You took a bad hit. It spun you around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c83 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 51B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It hangs. Then...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe I do need a little time.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: All right then. Good seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Likewise. Tony walks from the hangar. Rhodey watches him go. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - DAYS LATER - NIGHT C83 Tony tests out the prototype of a gauntlet. Clips the gauntlet wires to the chest bandolier. He extends his arm lets off a burst of RT from his palm -- It tips over a toolbox, scattering wrenches. Pepper, who’ been watching in the b.g., approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Thought you were done with weapons.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s a flight-stabilizer.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Well, watch where you’re pointing your “fight-stabilizer”, would you? (then) Obadiah’s upstairs -- should I tell him you’re in?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Be right up. She leaves a small package on a worktable and departs. To turns, spotting the box. Intrigued, he tears it open to f His old chest-device, mounted in Lucite, glowing faintly. It’s inscribed: PROOF THAT TONY STARK HAS A HEART... He smiles. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 52. 83 INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 83 Obadiah sets a pizza down on the table. Tony paces, full manic energy.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This -- this is the big-big idea. It can pull the company in a whole new direction.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: That's great. Get me the design as soon as you can. We've gota hungry production line that knock out a prototype in days. Tony looks at Obadiah, getting emotional.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know, I had a moment there where I was...reluctant...but I know now I made the best decision. I feel like I’m doing something... right, finally. (meaning it) Thank you for supporting me in this. Obadiah nods, touched, then --

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Listen, I have something to talk to you about. I really wish you'd attended the last board meeting like I asked you to.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I know, I’m sorry. What did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: The board's filed an injunction against you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: They claim you’re unfit to run the company and want to lock you out.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: How the hell can they do that? It’s my name on the building! My ideas that drive that company. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 52A.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: They're going to try. We’1ll fight them, of course.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: With the amount of stocks we own I thought we controlled the company.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Somehow they pulled enough votes together. Listen, the world doesn’t share your vision, Tony. The more people have to lose, the more frightened they are of new ideas. He pours two drinks. Tony declines.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Now listen, I don’t want you to get all in knots. You know how many times I protected your father from the wolves? Tony nods, still troubled.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Get back to your lab and work some magic. You let me handle the board. Oh and Tony, no more press conferences. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  84 85 86

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 87
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - DAYS LATER - DAY 88 Tony’s suit is now comprised of a stabilizer belt, partia chromed propulsion boots and the Mark II gauntlets. Everything connected by tubing and wires -- he looks like crazy science experiment. Tony fires up the boots, hovers. Then he fires the gloves stabilize. Weaving, tilting. He “surfs” mid-air, trying t maintain balance, slowly getting the hang of it. Then he ventures forward, moving along the expanse of the lab. Dodging pieces of equipment, his car collection, a f near misses -- but he maintains control. Debris and objec are blown from tables from the propulsive force. The joy of flight.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Nothing to it... He cuts the propulsion and lands. Looks to Jarvis.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: All right. Let’s get to work.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK. 90
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK -- out of a dark hole in the chest-plate of Tony’s original gray armor -- and show the whole battered suit, being pieced together by Raza’s men. Then we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raza, his face healed now, watching the armor coming together, mesmerized. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - A WEEK LATER - NIGHT 91 A humanoid form walks out, shrouded in shadow. Then, ceil lights CLUNK on, one-by-one, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful scaly arms and legs. Steel vertebrae. The intens glow of Tony’s RT “heart” through the chestpiece. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  91 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 56.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ailerons and air brakes pop up as Tony moves his head and arms, “stretching”, getting the feel for his new body. The helmet -- its intrepid, steely gaze boring into us. Now we see the full-on Mark II suit, its seams and rivets still visible. The suit HUMS as it powers up.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Standby for calibration. The gauntlets and boots fire up, and Tony rises. Suddenly

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Whoa-- He loses balance, falls back onto the hood of his Saleen, crushing it. The ALARM goes off. Tony kills the alarm wit a blast of RT.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We should take this outside.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I must strongly caution against that. There are terabytes of calculations still needed --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: We'll do them in-flight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  91 92 93 94 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 57.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, the suit has not even passed a basic wind-tunnel test.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's why you’re coming with me. TONY’S POV - THE “HEADS-UP DISPLAY” The HUD comes alive as Jarvis “loads” into the suit’s on- board system. Tony fires boots and gauntlets again. He hovers, floating along the workshop’s driveway.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I suggest you allow me to employ Directive Four.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Never interrupt me while I’m with a beautiful woman?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s Directive Six. Directive Four: use any and all means to protect your life should you be incapable of doing so.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Whatever floats you, Jarvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony tumbles around the sky, trying to control his flight © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  95 96 97 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 58.

dialogues.speaker: INT. IRON MAN SUIT
dialogues.text: TONY’S POV: his “display” glows in front of us: altitude, power, vital signs. Beyond that -- The live horizon spins and jiggles out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony tucks his arms and legs tight, thrusts his chest, eventually finding -- The Delta Pose. And suddenly he’s in control. He pulls a few turns, and swishes along the ribbon of headlights on PCH. Then -- He carves a turn out over the ocean, dives. Whooping like kid on a coaster. The waves flash by fifty feet below and returning to shor He arcs into a high performance climb, passing the Santa Monica Pier and sees -- A Kid on the Ferris wheel spotting him. Eyes wide -- FLASH TO - KID’S POV: as Iron Man zips past.

dialogues.speaker: FROM ABOVE A CLOUD
dialogues.text: A glow, then Tony shoots out and keeps ascending; a steel Icarus reaching for the heavens. CLOSE ON - TONY’S MASK: ice crystals forming.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Power: fifteen percent. Recommend you descend and re-charge, Sir. But Tony isn’t listening.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Acknowledge, Mr. Stark--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tony, intoxicated, as the moon beckons, impossibly bright TONY'S DISPLAY: as all indicators begin flashing red.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Power at five percent. Threshold breached -- A POP then everything goes dark. Tony is yanked from his reverie. His display flashes: “SYSTEM SHUT-DOWN”.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Uhh, Jarvis? JARVIS --? The glow gone from his chest, the suit a dead hull. The world starts to pinwheel outside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony, plummeting back to Earth in a free fall. Piercing t clouds, surging towards the L.A. grid.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: STATUS, STATUS! REBOOT --— Then: another POP, and a SURGE. The heads-up display flickers back to life, the suit’s power returns.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Temporary power restored. Descend immediately. Tony works the boosters, to get the suit back under contr

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jarvis, I think we need to chat about, uh, Directive Four.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: May I remind you, the suit feeds off the same power source as your life-support. A zero-drain of RT will likely kill you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're a downer, Jarvis. But I appreciate the heads-up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 98 Tony, as he descends towards his estate grounds. He at an elegant landing stance, but can’t quite hold it -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Shall I take over?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No, I got it, I got it -- He punches through the roof of his mansion. INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS - NIGHT A99 He plunges through the foyer ceiling... INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - CONTINUOUS - NIGHT 99 And crashes through the ceiling of his garage, smashing t Shelby Cobra which is parked next to the damaged Saleen. He unlatches his helmet and yanks it off -- all the CAR ALARMS blaring around him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Perfect. Let’s do some upgrades. LAB — LATER 100 Tony’s out of the suit, which hangs nearby. He’s jazzed u typing fast on his terminal. The screens are alive with scrolling data, graphics and diagnostic tests. The plasma TV is on low in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was quite dangerous, Sir. Might I remind you, if the suit loses power, so does your heart.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it doesn’t have a seatbelt either. A few issues: main transducer felt sluggish at plus forty altitude. Same goes for hull pressurization. I’m thinking icing might be a factor.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The suit isn’t rated for high altitude. You’re expending eight percent power just heating and pressurizing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: +e HH FH FH HF + eH  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 60A.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Re-configure using the gold- titanium alloy from the Seraphim Tactical Satellite. It should ensure fuselage integrity to 50 thousand feet, while maintaining power-to-weight ratio.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Shall I render, utilizing proposed specifications?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Wow me. On the center screen, the Mark III prototype is being “bu by Jarvis. The final product appears: an all-gold version of the Mar III. Tony regards it.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hm. Bit ostentatious, don’t you think? He looks over at -- His hot-rod and motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: TONY

dialogues.text: Tonight’s Red-Hot Red Carpet is here at the Walt Disney Concert Hall, where Tony Stark’s third annual benefit for the Firefighter Family Fund has become the go-to charity gala on L.A.'’s high-society calendar. dialogues.text: --the man whose name graces the gold-lettered invitations hasn’t been seen in public since his highly controversial press conference, and rumors abound. Some say Stark is suffering from post traumatic stress and hasn’t left his bed in weeks. Tony returns his attention to the -- COMPUTER MONITOR: the red and gold Mark III revealed.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The work could take till morning to complete, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Good. I should come up for air anyway. As Tony exits, the Mark III factory gets to work.

dialogues.text: A fire-truck is parked outside. Obadiah poses for photos the red carpet. The crowd is a mix of kingmakers, pols an Generals -- along with celebs and stars. Suddenly, all the cameras swing over to -- Tony, decked out, exiting his Audi R8. He sees a white- haired man in a red smoking jacket, drowning between thre hot Women. Tony slaps him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Eyyy, there he is. My man! The man turns, it’s not Hugh Hefner, but Stan Lee.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Sorry, thought you were someone else. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought you were going to lay low.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s time to start showing my face again.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Let’s just take it slow, okay. I got the board right where we want them.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Great. Tony doesn’t want to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: See ya inside. (smile) Lots to talk about. He heads inside. (CONTINUED)

102 103 104 A classy band and polite dancing. We TRACK IN on Tony at bar, passing Patrons whispering and flicking glances.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Stark. He turns to find Phil Coulson -- all business.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Agent Coulson.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh...was I supposed to meet you here?

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: No, but you haven’t been returning my calls. This is serious, we need to get something on the books or I‘ll have to go official on you. Tony sees Pepper coming down the stairs. She looks stunni in a classic gown.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes, you’re right. I’m going to handle this right now. Let me check with my assistant. Tony beelines for Pepper. She’s surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Miss Potts -- can I have five minutes? You look...you look like should always wear that dress.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Thanks. It was a birthday present-- from you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I have great taste. Care to dance? Tony takes her hand and whisks her onto the dance floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  104

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: Tony and Pepper dance, looking good together.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Am I making you uncomfortable? You seem very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: No, I always forget to wear deodorant and dance with my boss in front of everyone I’ve ever worked with in a chiffon dress.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Would it help if I fired you?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You wouldn't last a week without me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: What’s your Social Security number?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Uh...

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: 119-64-5484 Off a shared smile we... © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. 61A. 104 Natural.

dialogues.text: NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 62-63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and Pepper under the stars, close together.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I was so uncomfortable. I hate being the center of attention like that and that’s why this one time in high school when I was supposed to be in a play... no, never mind... but you know that’s why I never like, wanted to have a big wedding... you know, because I thought everyone would be looking at me wearing a dress. Oh, no, no... I’m not saying, like, “wedding.” No, not like that. I’m just saying, you know... He plants one on her. She gets quiet. They both do. Then...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Can I get you another glass of wine?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: A vodka martini, extra dry, with extra olives as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Okay. He goes, then is stopped. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: And, Tony...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (waits)

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’m not a cheeseburger.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (smiles) No. You’re not a cheeseburger. She flushes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: The party going full tilt. Tony takes two drinks from the Bartender. Turns to find himself face-to-face with -- The reporter, Christine. The one-night stand he can’t esc

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Stark! I was hoping I could get a reaction from you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: How's panic?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: I was referring to your company’s involvement in this latest atrocity.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey, they just put my name on the invitations -- She thrusts a dossier of photos out to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Is this what you call accountability? He looks at the photos, going stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: When were these taken?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Yesterday. Good P.R. move, you tell the world you’re a changed man, even I believed you. THE PHOTOS: victorious insurgents, the Ten Rings insignia their vehicles, clutch Stark machine guns, RPGs. Behind, town burns, bodies strewn. A photo of civilians being marched in rows, pre-execution Stark weapons trained at their backs.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I didn’t approve this shipment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  64A.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Well your company did.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Come with me. He leaves, making a bee line for... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony strides out to the red-carpet paparazzi.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I made some promises I’m not going to be able to keep. I suggest you pull all your money out of Stark Industries immediately -- Obadiah is suddenly there, steering Tony up the entrance stairs.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Is this like a tick for you? Whenever you have a feeling, you start going to all the people who don’t trust you, who don’t protect you. They're going to put a spin on everything you say.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I got to ask you something. I’m dead serious about this. I’m not kidding. Am I losing my mind or is Pepper really cute? Do you think she’s attractive and interesting, or is it just that her hair is down? I’ve been out of the game for a while.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind. You're messing with the “guys in the rooms”, we're talking about billion dollar interests, the world order --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’m not worried about that right now --

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: -- you should be. You’ll disappear. I can’t protect you against people like that --? The Paparazzi has snuck up on them, snapping photos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 65A.

dialogues.speaker: DO YOU MIND
dialogues.text: They go further up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Tony don’t be so naive --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: -- naive? I was naive before, when I was growing up and they told me don't ever cross this line, this is how we do business. In the meantime we’re double-dealing under the table. We don’t even deserve to represent the United States --

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: -- Tony, you’re a child --!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: -- you don’t believe I can turn this company around, do you --?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: -- you’ve got about as much control over things as a child riding in the backseat of your father’s car with a red plastic steering wheel in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe I’1l just get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: You’re not even allowed in the car. (then) I’m the one who’s filing the injunction against you. Tony is shell-shocked. Then, he goes after Obadiah. They jostle and Obadiah backs off as Tony goes ballistic. The paparazzi snap photos.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: It’s the only way I could protect you. Aki (from earlier) and several Obadiah’s Men, smiling, bu steely-eyed, step in to prevent Tony from following Obadi to his waiting car. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (yelling after Obadiah) This is going to stop.
