dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  107 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 66-67. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - NIGHT 107 Tony, wearing a Mark III gauntlet, wired to his RT chest- piece, turns a screwdriver to adjust the power. On the wall beside him -- A flatscreen TV: live war footage, refugees huddled. The bottom crawl reads, “BREAKING NEWS - TRAGEDY IN GULMIRA.”

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: -- the ten mile drive to the outskirts of Gulmira can only be described as a descent into Hell, into a modern-day Heart of Darkness. Simple farmers and herders, from peaceful villages, driven from their homes at the butt of Western rifles and the turrets of modern tanks. Displaced from their lands by Warlords and insurgent groups emboldened by their newfound power -- a power fueled by high-tech weapons easily purchased with Poppy money on the black market -- and further destabilizing a fragile region which for decades has been a tinderbox of tribal feuding and ethnic hatred -- Tony aims the gauntlet at some light fixtures. Gives them RT blast. They spark and fall from the ceiling. TV REPORTER'S VOICE (CONT’D) The villagers have taken shelter in whatever crude dwellings they can find -- in the ruins of other razed villages, in the cold barren scrublands, or in the remnants of an old Soviet smelting plant. Our translator relayed to us one human tragedy after another. A seven year old boy, thin as a scarecrow, clutching yellowed photographs and holding them out to anyone who would stop, with a child’s simple question: where are my mother and father? A woman, begging for news of her husband, who’d been kidnapped by insurgents -- either forced to join their militia, or to be shot without reason -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  107 108

dialogues.speaker: A109
dialogues.text: 109 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 66-67A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tony adjusts the gauntlet again, raising the power level. Blasts a window in the lab, shattering the glass and knoc a painting off the wall. TV REPORTER'S VOICE (CONT’D) With no political will or international pressure, there is little hope for these newly-formed refugees. Refugees who can only wonder one thing: is the world watching? A final adjustment. Another RT blast -- this time Tony wi out the plasma TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER 108
dialogues.text: Pepper enters, regards the destruction, the massive hole the ceiling, then Tony. He is stoic.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell me what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (never looking at her) Get my house in Dubai ready. I want to throw a party. She's flustered by his abrupt tone.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Yes. Mr. Stark.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: EXT. TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - DUSK 109 Festively lit up, music cranking. Expensive cars pulling valets scurrying. Beautiful people everywhere. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony weaves through glitzy guests, saying hello, shaking hands, slapping shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: TYCOON
dialogues.text: Tony! You never said what is the big occasion?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Ever known me to need one? The Tycoon laughs, as Tony keeps moving. EXT. TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - POOLSIDE - HOURS LATER - NIGHT The party in full tilt now. Guests dancing everywhere, or splashing around in the pool. Tony moves along, arm-in-arm with two exotic beauties (DU BEAUTY #1 & DUBAI BEAUTY #2). Pepper approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Well you seem back in old form.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Life of the party -- isn’t that what everyone wanted? (then) Cue the fireworks in five, would you?

dialogues.speaker: DUBAI BEAUTY
dialogues.text: Kinky! He stumbles towards the house with the two giggling women

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Sure. (with edge) Don’t hurt yourself. INT. MASTER BEDROOM - TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - MINUTES LATER

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Dubai beauties tumble onto the huge bed.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Why don’t you two...get started without me. They laugh and he checks his watch, then slips out a side door, instantly sober. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 68A. EXT. TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - POOLSIDE - MINUTES LATER - NIGH Guests congregate, watching the massive fireworks show. T HISS and BOOM of launching and bursting rockets.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Alone, staring off. She spots a streaking ‘rocket’, but unlike the others, it disappears without exploding. CLOSER - FIREWORKS: heavy concussion, lighting up the sky © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: EXT. SKY - DAWN All12 Tony flying against the backdrop of rising dawn. Peaceful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mortar explodes in our face. Smoke drifts away revealin A terrified MOTHER and her FOUR KIDS huddled in a cave-li crawlspace. She doesn’t have enough arms to cover them al THEIR POV - OF ‘ALLEY’ OUTSIDE: an abandoned industrial facility. GUNFIRE, SCREAMING. In the distance -- Ragged tents and shanties are beset upon by black clad Irregular Forces, firing and burning and destroying. Soldiers toss grenades into rat holes. Hunter-killer team fire at offscreen targets -- then smile with satisfaction The oldest of the four kids in the crawlspace darts out i the alley, frantically calling --

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Arto! ARTO! On his way back he’s surprised by a four man hunter-kille team. They shout at him to drop the puppy, but he won't. The men cock their guns, briefly distracted by a strange rocket-streak in the sky. Never mind, they take aim on th boy, and are about to fire when -- IRON MAN lands before them, slamming his fist to the grou in the classic Granov fist smash. With a single RT blast The Soldiers are thrown fifty yards. Tony scoops up the K with the barking mutt in his arms, and they take off.

dialogues.speaker: CRAWLSPACE
dialogues.text: Iron Man drops down, delivering Kid and dog back to safet The Kid, ignoring his mother’s protests, darts back out t watch Iron Man. He sees -- A Soldier flying like a ragdoll from behind a heap of bri (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Boy moves for a better view and sees Iron Man in full terrible glory, deflecting withering fire while laying wa to a cluster of militants with his fists and bursts of RT Refugees slowly emerge from their cover, stunned to watch Soldiers retreating in fear.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Raza, his wounds healed like papier-maché, observing his retreating men from a command post. He grabs a rifle, ste through a building, and spots -- Iron Man, in the distance, throwing a Soldier through a w Raza scrunches into nook, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: IRON MAN
dialogues.text: Picks a Soldier up, who’s about to fire an RPG. Holds an palm to the man’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (shuddering in terror) Geneva Convention! Article Three! Geneva Convention -- Tony disarms the soldier, tosses him down. The Soldier scrambles away for his life. Suddenly Tony is jarred by a sniper’s bullet. INTERCUT - INT. TONY’S SUIT - SAME TIME A thermal silhouette of a rooftop sniper. Tony fires RT, “OUT OF RANGE” flashes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony is hit again. He spots a Jeep wheel and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Calculations cascade across Tony’s display, culminating i hyperbolic arc with a blinking target.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Full view of Tony as he whips the wheel like a discus.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  114 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sniper, as he’s hit and flies off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony, turning, intrepid -- he’s ready to mop up the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the glow of consoles, and on huge SCREENS, Officers wa grainy satellite views of the action on the ground. SCREENS: A vague figure moving through the battle haze an smoke. Flying, blasting -- Insurgents fleeing. MAJOR ALLEN (50s) enters the CAOC, taking in the Images.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Are we in there?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Negative, it’s a local skirmish, green-on-green.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: (scrutinizing the screens) Anyone want to tell me what the hell I’m looking at?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: A drone? An advanced robotic? We don't know what it is, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Get someone down here from Weapons Development -- now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emboldened Refugees emerge from hiding in droves, when -- A tank shell blasts the building next to Tony. He stagger The tank rolls towards him smashing makeshift hovels. Tony gets to his feet, squares off with the tank, its tur zeroing on him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  114 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 71A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tony's H.U.D.: switching to a schematic overlay of the St designed tank. He identifies its weak spot, then --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A forearm panel pops open on Tony’s suit, revealing a min missile pod. He fires and -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  114 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 72.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The missile nails the weak spot. A chain reaction, then - The tank explodes, raining debris. Then -- Tony is surprised from behind. He whirls, brandishing his glowing palm. But it’s only -- The little Boy from earlier, holding an apple out to him. musses the boy’s hair, waves and -- Takes off. The Kid watches in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a rat hiding in a crawlspace. He dials on a Sat-Phon watching as Iron Man flies below the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Put me through to the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheering faces as Tony does a low pass over them, and cli into the sky. The battlefield smolders below as Tony rises to the cloud INTERCUT - INT. TONY’S SUIT - SAME TIME - DAY

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Jarvis, plot a course for home.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CENTRAL AIR OPS CTR
dialogues.text: Rhodey enters, pulling off his jacket. He paces past scre taking in the SAT-IMAGES of Iron Man's assault on Gulmira

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: So what do we have here, Rhodes?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s Russian, or Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Then where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: (thinking, then--) Let me make a call. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 72a.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rhodey punches a number on a console. All around him, pixellated images of destruction.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: An INCOMING CALL flashes up on Tony’s HUD. D.O.D. EMERGEN CALL.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then) Put it through, Jarvis. (listens) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Rhodey paces listening to the headset, away from the chao

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Tony, it’s Rhodey. (then) What the hell’s that noise?

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m in the convertible. Not the best time --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: TONY’S SUIT

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I need a quick ID. What do you know about un-manned combat robotics, with air-ground capabilities.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Never heard of anything like that. Why?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CAOC, a TOPO MAP showing Iron Man’s “dot” about to cross line.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: UAV has entered the no-fly zone--

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Because I think I’m staring at one right now, and it’s about get blown to Kingdom Come. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 72B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALARMS add to the frenzy of the control room.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Rhodes! You got something for me?

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uhh...’kingdom come’?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Two USAF F-22 Raptors flash out of the clouds like sharks

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: TONY’S HUD: His ALARM SOUNDS, “PROXIMITY WARNING” FLASHES

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This is my exit -- gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: SKY 115
dialogues.text: FRONTAL: we see Tony going turbo and rolling out of view treacherous bank. The F-22s curve expertly onto his tail.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ballroom Control -- this is Viper 1 & 2 checking in. UAV is in sight.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Viper: target at 330 for 10 miles. Tony screams past us, trying to outrun the pursuing jets.

dialogues.speaker: A116 CONTROL ROOM A116
dialogues.text: The CAOC SCREENS now fill up with images from the belly-c of the Raptors. The pursuit of Iron Man. Awe-inspiring. Officers react. Rhodey’s face. Holy shit. What is it? INTERCUT - INT. F-22 (viper 1) - FLYING - SAME TIME - DAY From behind the Pilot: as he fights to stay with Tony. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 72C.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1
dialogues.text: Ballroom, contact appears to be an unmanned aerial vehicle--

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ballroom copies, you are cleared to engage. The cockpit’s BITCHING-BETTY now speaks in a calm voice.

dialogues.speaker: BITCHING-BETTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Locked on! Locked on!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 1's F-22 fires a SIDEWINDER MISSILE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man goes full tilt as the missile closes in fast.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: TONY’S HUD: a red dot moves across the center of his face

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Incoming Sidewinder in five... four...three...two... ‘COUNTER-MEASURES’ flashes on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A hatch opens on the Iron suit. Chaff is released.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The Sidewinder hits the cloud of chaff and -- The missile detonates. Iron Man shoots from the fireball. The Raptors veer. Iron Man dives, rolls into dizzying evasive maneuvers. Pulling heavy Gs. The F-22s stay glued to his tail.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: HUD: Tony nearly blacks out as the G-Force Meter hits red (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, may I remind you that the suit can handle these maneuvers. You cannot.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The F-22s now spray heavy cannon-fire in Iron Man's path. Tracer rounds streak past Tony, exploding, hitting him, ricocheting off the armor. Tearing him up.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jarvis -- AIR BRAKES! The brakes pop out from the suit and Tony instantly slams down to a quarter-speed. The jets blow past him.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1
dialogues.text: That was not a drone. Viper 1, checking his scope. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Rhodey, his wheels beginning to turn, stares at the belly monitors. Nothing but sky and clouds. Then --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Lt. Colonel Rhodes, I have Tony Stark calling--

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Put him through. The call clicks on Rhodey’s headset. A low ROAR in the b. Rhodey strains to hear.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rhodey, I had Jarvis run a check. I might have some info on that UAV. A piece of gear like that might exist. Might definitely exist -- Rhodey speaks low, away from the Major. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t happen to be red and gold, would it?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 1&2 in close formation, searching, searching. Viper begins to bank slowly, and coming into view -- Iron Man -- clinging to the underside of one of the Rapto

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Viper 2 -- he’s on your belly! Shake him!

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What--?

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: ALLEN’s eyes go wide at the belly-cam images. The Iron su hangs on for dear life as the Raptor tries to shake it.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ballroom: that is definitely not a UAV.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: What is it then?

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think it’s...a Man, sir. PUSH IN: on Rhodey, as all the pieces click.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. (then) Tony--! But the line is dead.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 2, frantic, looking out both sides of the cockpit, trying to spy Iron Man, shaking the jet harder.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Still there Viper 2. ROLL! ROLL! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Viper 2 works the stick, world becoming a centrifugal blu

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 2 engages in dangerous rolls. The horizon spins as Iron Man clings desperately for life.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INSIDE SUIT: BUZZERS. WARNING LIGHTS FLASH: “POWER 28%”.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir: two minutes and there won’t be sufficient power to get home.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Finally, Tony is jarred loose, tumbling and -- Hits Viper 1's tail-fin, shearing it off. The jet careens out of control.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’M HIT!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Inside Viper 1’s Raptor, spiraling crazily. Viper 1 pulls his EJECT and blasts out of the crippled je

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The sky, as we fall with Viper 1, his chute failing to op as he pulls the damaged lever. And he continues plunging, Earth and sky revolving like o

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Viper 2, do you see a chute?

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Negative! No chute, no chute--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man zipping through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Power critical, set course for home immediately. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Tony dives, vortices curling off his feet as he pursu the tumbling pilot.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The UAV is going after him! It’s attacking--!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man reaches the pilot, and they are face to face a s second, before he yanks the chute mechanism free and -- The chute snaps open, yanking the pilot up and out of vie

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: GOOD CHUTE! GOOD CHUTE! You’re not gonna believe this, Ballroom... but that thing just saved his ass. Iron Man banks sharply, coming dangerously close to the ground. Viper 2 barrel-rolls onto his tail.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Rhodey and Major ALLEN are glued to the SCREENS.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Viper 2: re-engage.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Major, call off that Raptor. You don't know what you’re shooting at.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: We'll find out when recover the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 2's Bitching Betty activates.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKED ON
dialogues.text: Viper 2, staying with Tony in a barrel roll-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 72H.

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2
dialogues.text: Ballroom: understand, you want me to engage the UAV? The Pilot’s finger hovers over the kill button.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Negative, Viper 2, disengage.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: It’s not your call. That thing just took out an F-22 inside a legal no-fly zone (then) Viper 2: you get a clean shot you take it. Rhodey’s eyes are locked on the screens.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Viper 2 fires its missile. It races towards Iron Man. Evasive maneuvers, chaff released. Then the explosion -- too close for comfort. Iron Man is thrown from the frame the fireball.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man’s “dot” vanishes from the screens.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR ALLEN
dialogues.text: Viper 2. Can you confirm the kill?

dialogues.speaker: VIPER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I got him good. He went down, he was smokin’. But I cannot confirm. Rhodey reacts. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 73. Al17 A117 © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  116

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 74-78. 116

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED B118
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - ALCOVE - SAME TIME - DAY c118 Pepper sitting on a small bench, head propped in her hand having dozed off. A WHOOSH and a streak flashes outside the window, startli her awake. Pepper rises, looking around, then exits frame -- INT. TONY’S DUBAI VILLA - SITTING ROOM - MINUTES LATER - Pepper enters, cautiously, moving towards something in th shadows. We hinge as she passes us, to REVEAL -- Tony, sitting in a huge chair, the armor scarred and stil smoking. Helmet off, bleeding from the nose and ears. A drink in one shaky hand.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Get me home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few yurts. Raza’s bivouacked men lick their battle woun A devastated band. They grab their guns and stand-to as - A train of black Suburbans arrive. Private Security Guard exit and take up positions. Then -- The scarred Raza saunters out of a yurt and goes to the l Suburban. Its door opens and out steps -- Obadiah Stane gazes about, unfazed, then --

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Welcome. Obadiah assesses the scars on Raza’s face.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Compliments of Tony Stark. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 TOA.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: If you’d killed him when you were supposed to, you’d still have a face.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: You paid us trinkets to kill a prince. An insult, to me and the man whose ring I wear. CLOSE ON - RAZA‘'S RING: the familiar ten interlocked rin

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: I think it’s best we don’t get him involved in this. (then) I’ve come a long way to see this weapon. Show me.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Come. Leave your guards outside. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 80-81. INT. RAZA’S YURT - NIGHT 120 Obadiah enters and stares down, transfixed. STANE’S POV: THE REASSEMBLED GRAY ARMOR suspended on wire

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: His escape bore unexpected fruit.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: (as it dawns on him) -..So this is how he did it.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: This is only a crude first effort. But he’s perfected his design-- Raza hands grainy surveillance photos to Stane. CLOSE ON - VARIOUS PHOTOS: Iron Man wreaking havoc in Gulmira. Stane has seen the future. Then he looks down at -- Tony’s crusty laptop. The onion-skin schematics.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: The inside of Tony Stark’s mind. Raza arranges the schematics on a light board, and the sketches laid together become...Iron Man.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Everything you will need to build this weapon. Obadiah is circling the armor now, taking it all in. Raza sits and pours tea.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: Stark has made a masterpiece of death. A man with a dozen of these could rule from the Pacific to the Ukraine. And you dream of Stark’s throne -- we have a common enemy. Now Stane pokes at the vacant hole in the chest plate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  120 121 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 80-81A.

dialogues.speaker: RAZA
dialogues.text: If we are back in business, I give you these designs as my gift. In turn, I hope you will repay me with a gift of iron soldiers. Obadiah smiles, places his hands on Raza’s shoulders, as going to hug him in brotherhood.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: (in perfect Urdu) This...is the only gift you shall receive. Raza is strangely confused. Paralyzed. Blood begins runni from his ear. And now, in Obadiah’s hand, we realize he’s holding a dev A sonic taser. Obadiah removes a pair of filtering ear-plugs as Raza crumples to the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Technology -- (holds up the taser) it’s always been your Achilles Heel. Don’t worry, it'll wear off in fifteen minutes -- but that’s the least of your problems. Obadiah removes Raza’s ring, studies it. Then he turns an exits-- EXT. RAZA’S YURT - CONTINUOUS - NIGHT 121 As he steps out of the tent, Obadiah sees -- By the Suburbans, Raza’s men kneel, guns to their heads.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: (to head guard) Crate up that armor and the rest of it. We TRACK WITH Obadiah as he passes Raza’s kneeling men.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Send them to their virgins. The SOUND of MACHINE GUN FIRE. Obadiah does not flinch. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 82. 124 INT. PHIL COULSON’S OFFICE - DAY 124 Phil Coulson at his desk. He picks up the phone and dials

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Ms. Potts. It’s Agent Coulson from the Strategic Homeland Inter--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. Unfortunately Tony is not going to be available to sit down with you for a while.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Really? And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s uh, there’s a...Tony won’t be--

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Maybe I can meet with you instead? INTERCUT - TONY’S LIVING ROOM - SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Why? I don’t know anything.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: About anything. There's a BUZZ. Pepper eyes the security monitor and sees Rhodey.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Pepper. It’s Rhodey.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (pressing a button) Come in.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'd just like to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I’m really jammed right now. Booked solid for the next few weeks. I have to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rhodey enters, grim.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Let’s just put something on the books. How about (checks his calendar) the twenty-eighth? Seven PM, at Stark Industries?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Great. Perfect. Bye. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: How’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Not so good.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: I want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You can’t see him right now. Rhodey eyes the hole in the ceiling, worried now.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here? (off her silence) Let me in there, Pepper. She faces off with him. Then allows him by.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You want to see him? Fine. See what you’ve done to him. INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - STARK ESTATE - MINUTES LATER BA123 Tony lies in bed, tethered to all sorts of medical equipm Rhodey enters, stunned at Tony’s state. Pulls up a chair sits. Tony drifts in and out of consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Look at you...what were you thinking? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Weapons I built are being used to kill innocent people. Can’t let that happen anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You can’t go around and blow up stuff every time you see something you don’t like on TV.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yes I can.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You got lucky, next time they’11l blow you to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Next time, maybe I won’t play defense. Rhodey, floored, gets to his feet. Paces.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Does Pepper know about this? He nods, his eyes starting to flicker.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: You've put me in a tough spot here. What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That’s up to you. I’ve made my choice -- I’m not going to sit on the sidelines anymore -- I’m going to fight for what’s right.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it? It’s not up to us to decide.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That’s where you’re wrong... He drifts into unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windowless and full of pipes. The Mark I armor, dissected into its pieces, hovers mid air, suspended by wires. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: A123
dialogues.text: 123 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 82Cc.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Elite Engineers from the Stark empire are hard at work, milling and machining armored parts. Obadiah walks among them.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Civilization, gentlemen, has been preserved by the right people having the right idea at the right time. You are shaping in your hands, this very moment, the future of this company, and this nation. But it is imperative this project remain data-masked, that it’s existence never leave these walls. Make no mistake -- this is a ‘tool’, that in wrong hands, could jeopardize civilization as we know it. Obadiah faces the Head Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Give us full access to the Sampson Cluster, and we’ll have you a prototype in record time.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: The Sampson’s yours. We go 24-7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yinsen, framed by the mountains in the b.g., stares at us

dialogues.speaker: YINSEN
dialogues.text: Are you on the right path? I don’t know...what does your heart tell you, Stark? HOLD on Yinsen, then --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - DAY 123 Tony waking up in his gilded bedroom, alone. He catches his own sad reflection in a mirror. Hooked up IVs and machinery that PINGS and HISSES. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 82D.

dialogues.speaker: A125 OMITTED A125
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 83.

dialogues.speaker: B125 OMITTED B125
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 84. C125 INT. TONY’S BEDROOM - DAY C125 Pepper enters and finds Tony’s bed empty. D125 INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - DAY D125* Pepper enters as Tony toils away at an eviscerated suit suspended from a chain winch.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This device will hack into Stark Industries mainframe. I need you to go to there and retrieve all shipping manifests. +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Absolutely not you should be in bed... +e %

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: ...they’ve been dealing weapons under the table and I’m going to stop them. + eH

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. I’m not helping you with anything if you’re going to start this again. + eH

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: There is nothing else. There’s no art opening. There’s no benefit. There’s nothing to sign. There’s no decisions to be made. There’s the next mission and nothing else. There’s nothing except this.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I quit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Really? You stood there by my side when all I did was reap the benefits of wholesale irresponsibility and destruction and now that I’m trying to right those wrongs and protect the people I put in harms way you’re going to walk out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: You're going to kill yourself. I can’t support that.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: So far so good. (beat) Pepper. I know what I have to do. I don’t know if I can, but I know in my heart that it’s right. And you do too. And I can’t do it without you. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 84a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obadiah, next to his Head Engineer. Behind them are the hulking steel legs of the Dynamo, extending out of frame. The sparks from a welding gun shower down.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD ENGINEER
dialogues.text: There’s no technology that can power this thing.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: I told you, miniaturize the ARK reactor.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD ENGINEER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Stane, I’ve tried. What you’re asking for can’t be done.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Tony Stark was able to do it ina cave -- with a box of scraps.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Well...I’m not Tony Stark. HOLD ON - OBADIAH: his mind churning something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After hours, few people around. Pepper hurries down the dimmed main hallway of Stark Industries. Casting nervous glances back behind her. INT. TONY’S OFFICE - MINUTES LATER - DAY 126 Pepper at Tony’s computer. She plugs in the hacking devic (the size of a jump-drive) Tony gave her. MONITOR: the screen as the device starts hacking through Obadiah’s passwords, firewalls, security nets. She's in. She watches items scroll up from Obadiah’s hard drive. MONITOR: Jericho Missile orders. Shipping manifests.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Make a copy of everything-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  126 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 85-86A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More. Schematics and blueprints. For sections of the Dyna suit. For the pipe room under the Ark Reactor.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Obadiah? She glances towards the door, thinking she heard somethin Waits. Nothing. THE MONITOR: an icon now appears, with Arabic text underneath. An icon for a video clip. She double clicks, watches--

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: A grainy video clip opens: Tony, half-dead, tied to a cha Raza and his henchmen behind him. It’s the ‘decapitation tape’ made in the cave months ago. She shakes her head, disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Translate-- CLOSE ON - MONITOR: as the clip plays, the translated tex appears like subtitles: “Obadiah Stane, you have deceived us...the price to kill Tony Stark has just gone up...” Pepper, shell-shocked, gapes at the monitor. PEPPER'S POV: she looks up from the monitor to see Stane standing there in the doorway. She nearly leaps out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: What a nice surprise.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I...just wanted to get some of my personal stuff. (nods to the monitor) And my resume. In case. (grins) You know how I love job hunting. He circles around the desk and Pepper quickly changes screens, replacing the DOWNLOAD INDICATOR with GOOGLE.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: How's Tony? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  126 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 85-86B.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Honestly...I don’t know. He’s shut me out.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: You and everyone else. He circles her, picking up a photo on the desk of Tony. Pepper stiffens, flicks a glance at -- The hacking jump-drive protruding. The WHIRR and GRIND of the hard drive as it copies Stane’s files.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: This...thing between you, it’s hurting him. You’re the only real father Tony ever had. It would mean so much if you could just talk --

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) Tony’s imploding -- it’s unfortunate. (then) You should consider whether you want to take that ride with him.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: “Unfortunate?”

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: You know I love Tony -- but this is business. We can’t save him, but we can save his legacy. She flashes to the download screen, “87%” completed.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: It’s tragic, but...Tony never really came home, did he? He circles behind her again, looking closely at the scree again depicting Google ads.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: This company has a bright future, I'd like you to be a part of it. He smiles and touches her cheek. She shuts off the comput

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Tony doesn’t understand your value. He never did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 85-86C.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Are you...offering me a job?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Think about it. (then) Come on, I’1l walk you out. He takes her box of personal effects, waits for her. As s passes the computer, she snatches the jump drive out, pal it. A tense moment: did he see her? © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 87-88.

dialogues.speaker: A133 OMITTED A133
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 89.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 133
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  134 135 136 137 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 90-91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper descends the stairs as Obadiah hovers above on the balcony railing -- watching her. PEPPER'S POV: by the Security Desk, a savior: Agent Couls gestures and argues with the Security Guard. Pepper rushes over, startles Coulson by linking arms with and dragging him towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: Miss Potts, did you forget our appointment?

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: No. Of course not. I’ve been very much looking forward to it. Let’s-- (looks over her shoulder) -- why don’t we do this somewhere else? They push outside. Obadiah still watches from above.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 137
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 92. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - NIGHT A138 Noisy as Tony slaves away on the CNC machine. Behind him A SCREEN: listing six messages, all the same: “MISSED CAL PEPPER.” Suddenly, the CNC machine powers down unexpectedly.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What gives, Jarvis?

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have a visitor, Sir. Obadiah Stane is here. INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 138 Obadiah holds a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: It’s UNOS. Four cheese. I just had it flown in from Chicago. Tony remains stoic. Obadiah puts the pizza down, crosses Tony and hands him a letter.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: I'd like you to proof-read something for me.

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Would you like me to spell-check it, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Can you turn him off? All the way?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (as he scans the letter) Spin down Jarvis. Tony looks up from the letter, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Your resignation.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: You were right. It’s not my company -- not my name on the building. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  138 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 92A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OBADIAH (cont'd) We were a great team...but I guess this is where our paths diverge. Tony hears a blip from the phone system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “INCOMING. PEPPER POTTS” appears. Tony looks to Obadiah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pepper. I should take that.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Tony. Please. I’11 be out of here in a minute. Tony finally nods, pushes a button, sending the call to v mail. Obadiah meets Tony’s eyes, fatherly. Puts a hand on Tony’ shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: We have too much history to part on bad terms. I'd like your blessing. Tony’s eyes, suddenly registering a paralyzing pain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  138 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 93.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FLASH ON: Stane’s ear, the blue electronic ‘filter’, like ones he wore with Raza. Tony sinks back in his chair. Stane places the sonic tase down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Easy, now. Try to breathe... He kneels beside Tony. Unbuttons Tony’s shirt.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: You can’t mess with progress, Tony. It’s an insult to the Gods. You created your greatest weapon ever -- but you think that means it belongs to you. It belongs to the world. CLOSE ON - TONY’S EYES: wide with pain, unable to move. A he can do is gasp and gurgle as -- Stane begins removing the chest-piece from its socket.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Your “heart” will be the seed of the next generation of weapons. They’1l help us steer the world back in the right direction -- put the balance of power back in our hands. The right hands. CLOSE ON - OBADIAH: he removes Tony’s “heart”, the RT glo reflecting on his face.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: By the time you die, my prototype will be operational. (smiles) It’s not as conservative as yours. He wraps the heart in cloth. Then stands, clicking off th sonic taser and pocketing it. Tony rolls from the chair, onto his back, staring at the ceiling. Already slipping away. Then--

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: The sad thing is...we’re both the good guys. Obadiah kills the lights and leaves © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 93A. 139 INT. RHODEY’S OFFICE - NIGHT 139 Rhodey is on the phone with Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean, he paid to have Tony killed? Slow down. Why would Obadiah-- (listens) Where is Tony now? © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper, Coulson and five dark-suited Agents walk with urg towards two Crown Victorias. Pepper is on her cellphone, worried--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: --I don't know, he’s not answering his phone. Will you just go over there and check on him? Thanks Rhodey. She CLICKS off. The Agents pile into the Crown Vics, and Coulson holds a door open for her. Pepper instead beelines for her parked Audi.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I know a short cut. She hops in. Coulson looks at the Agent behind the wheel, then back at Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: COULSON
dialogues.text: I’ll ride with her. Coulson hurries over, jumps in and the Audi races off. Th Crown Vics try to keep up. INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT B140 Tony, on fumes, pulls himself up a shelving system. It topples, spilling items -- including the Lucite-encased h Pepper gave him. He crawls to it, smashes it open. CLOSE ON - TONY’S HAND: lifting the glowing chest piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obadiah inserts the glowing “heart” he stole from Tony’s chest into the Dynamo’s chest. We can only see slivers of the full suit on its scaffolding. The heart locks in place and we go -- CLOSE ON - DYNAMO’S EYES: coming alive. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 94a.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 141
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 95.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 143
dialogues.text: A144 OMITTED Al44 © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  144

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: EXT. ARK REACTOR - STARK INT’L HQ - NIGHT 144 Pepper and the Agents stand outside the locked door to th sub-basement pipe-room. An Agent finishes laying detonato cord around the door hinges.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Clear. They take cover and the Agent hits a clacker. The door is blown off its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obadiah looks up at the -- SECURITY MONITORS: bad news. Pepper and the Agents infiltrating and moving towards the pipe room stairway. Obadiah’s face sets. He begins climbing up the scaffoldin to the Dynamo. INT. TONY’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT B145 We HEAR A DOOR SPLINTERING. Rhodey rushes in and finds -- Traces of blood on the floor. The collapsed shelving unit Tony staggering to stay on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Where’s Pepper?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, she’s with the Feds. They're on their way to Stark to arrest Obadiah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (grim--) They're going to need a lot more than a few Agents. Give me hand. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - NIGHT C145 The door swings open and Tony and Rhodey enter. Rhodey st shocked, his eyes playing over -- The Hall of Armor. The hanging Mark II suit. The weaponiz battle-ready Mark III. Components, rows of helmets, boots gauntlets and future design prototypes littered everywher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper and the Agents drift through a metal jungle of vat machines, armored limbs and guts hanging from tethers. Utility pipes run along the walls. They come upon the Mark I armor and stop, spooked. We notice: an empty scaffolding. Pepper advances, Coulson and his team fanning out. CLOSE ON - AN AGENT: looking off. Suddenly, he’s yanked o of frame. INT. TONY’S WORKSHOP - SAME TIME - NIGHT A146 Rhodey helps Tony rivet a last panel in place, then tosse him the Mark III helmet. Tony lowers the helmet. Blasts off through the hole in th ceiling, knocking it even wider. Rhodey stares after him, impressed as hell. Then -- He sees the Mark II, beelines for it. Considers, then -- Shakes his head. He moves for Tony’s car collection. Likes the R8. Hops in fires her up and screeches after Tony. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wandering the fringes, Pepper tries to make a call on her cell. No signal. PEPPER'S POV: through the pipes and girders, she spots wh may be a pair of glowing eyes. The WHIRR of hydraulics an

dialogues.speaker: GRINDING METAL --
dialogues.text: Wild gunfire suddenly breaks out. Bullets ricochet, hitti pipes, spewing steam and coolants. Pepper rushes away from the pandemonium. She whirls, squinting through the machine gears and steam seeing flashes of -- Agents running for cover, firing their guns at some giant flitting shadow. Another agent is yanked out of view and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, trying to find a way out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A piece of metal zips at her head, cutting pipes before i embeds itself in the cement above her. And now -- An Agent staggers out of the murk with his radio.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Agents down, agents down! (seeing Pepper) GET OUT OF HERE -- He throttles her towards the exit, then runs off, firing Pepper, half-way up the stairs, turns hearing the three-t THUMP of the Dynamo’s legs charging out of the mist, but The armor is too big for the stairwell and crashes into i a shower of debris. All we see is a brightly glowing chest-piece and arms, ra cement, grinding, trying to get up the stairs after -- Pepper, who fumbles her way up and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper slams the door behind her. Silence. She catches he breath, dials on her cell with shaky fingers --

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Tony! Obadiah’s got a whole assembly line under the Ark. He's inside one of them--!

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you--? Now she hears -- THUMP from below her. The asphalt cracks. Another THUMP a another and -- Pepper is knocked over as the asphalt bulges open to reve the Dynamo’s fist. Her cellphone skitters away. Like a hatching dinosaur, he peels away asphalt, pulling himself of the ground, and finally -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  148 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 98A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rises to his full height. He turns, face-to-face with Pepper, who’s a gnat against this dull-grey leviathan.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: (backpedaling) Obadiah... Dynamo keeps coming, not a single forgiving feature in th steel-face and dead eyes. Her foot hits her cellphone and she grabs it. And now she’s almost backed up against the Plexiglas of the ARK Reactor when --

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Tony--

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pepper, I have one thing I need to say to you: DUCK! Pepper dives as-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  148 149

dialogues.speaker: B150
dialogues.text: 150 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 99.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Dynamo stops, jerking his head up to see -- Iron Man, diving out of the sky at him, feet first. He la on the Dynamo’s shoulders, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iron giants crash back into the hole Dynamo crawled f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors fall and hit a grating. Dynamo breaks throug plunging through pipes and into the water below, while -- Iron Man tumbles along the unbroken part of the grating a falls out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The atrium glass ruptures outward from the underground impact. Pepper dives to shield herself. She sees-- The reactor-housing has been cracked. KLAXONS BLARE. Warning lights flash as the damaged reactor begins to ‘me down’. INT. SUB-BASEMENT PIPE ROOM —- SECONDS LATER - NIGHT B150 DYNAMO'’S POV: We emerge out of the water, searching for Man. INTERCUT - INT. TONY’S SUIT - SAME TIME - NIGHT 150 POV - MOVING: sweeping around the steel-maze with his INF RED, but perforated steam pipes cast red plumes and confu shadows everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s miraculous, Tony, it’s your Ninth Symphony. Trying to rid the world of weapons, you gave it its best one ever.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This wasn’t meant for the world. Still moving, still swiveling through the murk --

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How can you be so selfish? Do you understand what you’ve created? (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 99A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OBADIAH (0.S.) (cont'd) This will put the balance of power back in our hands for decades. Your country needs this.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: What kind of world will it be when everybody’s got one?

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your father helped give us the bomb. What kind of world would it be if he’d failed us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  150 151 152 153 154 155 156 157 158

dialogues.speaker: INT. DYNAMO SUIT
dialogues.text: STANE’S POV: waiting, as Iron Man emerges from behind machinery and girders. He doesn’t see Dynamo, who charges

dialogues.speaker: PIPE ROOM
dialogues.text: Iron Man realizes too late that Dynamo is coming at him l a bullet-train. He’s hit, driven backwards in Dynamo’s vi grip, and they -- 150 151 152 153 154 155 156 157 158

dialogues.speaker: A159
dialogues.text: Smash into the cement wall and punch clean through it ont © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  159 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crash into a truck trailer, passing through it and o the highway, tossing vehicles aside. More cars screech, collide. A HYDROGEN-POWERED bus jack- knives, narrowly averting disaster. People flee vehicles. In Tony’s H.U.D., “INCOMING CALL” flashes--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: A little busy, Pepper--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The reactor’s been it--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Get to the control room. Shut it down--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How the hell do I shut it down?? Dynamo rises first, grabs a Volvo station-wagon with a stunned mother and kids inside. Iron Man rises as the Dynamo lifts the car over his head.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Don’t. This is our fight.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: People are always going to die, Tony -- part of the chess game.

dialogues.speaker: INT. VOLVO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  159 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The world skewed fifteen feet below them. The mother whit knuckles the steering wheel in terror. The kids scream.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony, trying his palm RTs. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Emergency power!

dialogues.speaker: JARVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, you'll drain the --

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now! Dynamo winds up to throw the car when Iron Man nails him a huge Repulsor blast from his chest. Dynamo is knocked back, throwing the car at -- Iron Man, who catches it. But the weight is too much for armor to handle and he -- Buckles, saving the car from impact, but gets trapped underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony’s HEADS-UP DISPLAY: “POWER CRITICAL: RECHARGING...”

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Inside the Volvo, it takes everyone a moment to realize they’re okay. Then, as Dynamo clumps towards them--

dialogues.speaker: GO, MOM
dialogues.text: She stamps the gas.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man, dragged as the Volvo speeds forward. A shower o sparks fly from his suit. A wild weaving ride. Dynamo follows, using cars as stepping stones. People fle pell-mell, jumping the highway divider.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S AUDI R8 - SAME TIME - NIGHT A160 Rhodey driving like hell, HONKING. Tail lights flash past like tracers as he slaloms through tight traffic.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Iron Man finally manages to push the car off him. It spee away, three gaping Kids staring out the back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tony staggers up, trying to regain his footing as Dynamo pulls up. They clash in a CACOPHONY of steel and GRINDING HYDRAULIC Stane knocks Tony into a mini-van and pounds him merciles

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: TONY? Where are you--?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tony, his helmet now being squeezed by the Dynamo.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m in the control room. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Central panel. Red button. Press it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ARK REACTOR CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: DEAFENING KLAXONS. Pepper flips open a panel to find -- A HUNDRED BUTTONS. All red. All flashing.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Thanks, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s the delta rate? Pepper finds the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Damn -— (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 104.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Damn?! I don’t want to hear “damn.” GET UP HERE--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: TONY’S H.U.D. 161 Cracking under Dynamo’s pressure.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pepper, I’m delegating this to you.

dialogues.speaker: IRON MAN 162
dialogues.text: as he finally rolls and frees himself from Dynamo.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know what happens when that reactor blows. A lot of people are going to die.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: It didn’t have to end like this, Tony. You were down -- you should've stayed down. And they're about to collide again when -- A Shit Kicking Biker on a Harley weaves from around a tru He realizes his mistake and jams the throttle, but -- Dynamo grabs the front wheel of the motorbike, (sending t Biker flying), and in one swoop belts Iron Man with it. Tony tumbles away and struggles to get up. Falls, tries again, but Dynamo is all over him, smacking him with the bike. INT. TONY’S AUDI R8 - DRIVING - SAME TIME - NIGHT 163 Rhodey, in the breakdown lane, weaving around waves of fleeing people, toppled cars and debris till he sees -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  164 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 105.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dynamo standing over Tony, about to deliver his death-blo He red lines the engine and pops the clutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The R8 rockets forward. Zero to sixty in under three seconds. The Dynamo raises the Harley over his head, ready to smas Tony’s already broken helmet. He looks up a second too la The car hits Dynamo’s leg and crumples, tumbling away lik toy, and now -- The Dynamo, un-weighted, reels around to catch his balanc but pitches head-first into the hydrogen bus perforating CLOSE ON - DYNAMO: struggling to free himself. His gropin fingers set off a spark and -- HELLFIRE ERUPTS -- blanking the Dynamo and everything aro it. Flames roll over Tony. Over the crushed sports car, igniting its leaking tanks. Tony removes his broken helmet and staggers to the car, tearing it open like a can.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You had to take my car. He pulls out Rhodey, dazed and bloody.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Saving your ass is getting to be a full-time job. They regard the burning bus. Nothing moves. Just a heap o red-hot steel.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Get this area evacuated! There’s going to be a meltdown-- Tony's boosters ignite and he’s gone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  164 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 106.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pepper, how we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper, awash in EMERGENCY MANUALS, throws one over her shoulder -- flipping switches, turning dials. The whole place THRUMS with energy.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Thanks for checking in Tony. Delta’s at 2300. It’s not going down.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s too late.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Too late? What’s going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s going to blow a crater a mile wide. I’m coming to get you. She backs away from the monitors, disbelieving. INT. TONY’S SUIT - FLYING - SECONDS LATER - NIGHT 166 He heads towards the reactor, now a shimmering mass of energy. A row of SATELLITE DISHES on the roof of the reactor. It sparks an idea.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pepper, wait. Stay put -- we're going to overload the reactor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tony lands.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: IT’S ALREADY OVERLOADING --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No, it’s compressing energy. We're going to convert the plasma core to electricity and channel it up through the roof. Like a Tesla coil. © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  170 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper watches the core bulge.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t need a science lesson, just tell me what button to push --

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: See a red submarine hatch? A wheel -- a red wheel.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: ---no. YES -- She runs to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony re-arranges satellite dishes, pulling wires -- creat a makeshift Tesla coil.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Open it all the way, then standby to hit the master. We've only got one shot at this. He’s connecting a wire when the satellite dish beside him reflects an eerie yellow flicker. He turns, stunned as -- THE DYNAMO LANDS on the roof. Flames still licking off hi blackened suit. Obadiah moves closer to Tony --

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Pepper, hit the switch. PEPPER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electromagnetic tentacles arc from the reactor to the con room around Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: TONY? Which Master Switch -- She eyes her phone. It’s dead. And in front of her -- A row of “MASTER” switches blink... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  170 171 172 173 SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 108.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I am so looking for another job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dynamo, smoking like an oil fire, about to reach Tony INT. ARK REACTOR CONTROL ROOM —- SAME TIME - NIGHT 172 Pepper hits all the switches, then diving under the conso for cover as the world goes steel-blue. An electromagnetic pulse (EMP) flashes upwards along the reactor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the searing flash of the EMP is momentarily ‘halted’ between the satellite dishes, vaporizing the roof in betw Then -- The EMP surges outwards, turning Dynamo and Iron Man into statues as the pulse knocks out his power and electronics FROM UP HIGH: the EMP blast travels concentrically outwar rendering everything dark in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The roof, as it sags down in the center. Tony, dazed, looks at his heart-device. It’s dead too. The Dynamo, closest to the collapsed section of the roof, topples over. Its dead fingers catch on a seam and it lie precariously on the edge of the ‘slope’. The Dynamo hatch opens, revealing Obadiah -- OBADIAH’S POV: through the hole in the roof, the seething plasma bubbling below. Tony, using his own waning strength, tries to extend a de Iron Man hand to Obadiah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Take my hand... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  173 174

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: So this is the answer, Tony? This is how you’re going to save the world? It’s not in you. Your father told me before he died, my boy doesn’t have a warrior’s heart. I should have listened.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: My father never knew me.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: But I do. Now we see what Stane is attempting: to manually winch hi forearm rocket bay open so he can blast Tony. But his movements unsettle the Dynamo suit and suddenly h begins to slide.

dialogues.speaker: OBADIAH
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my boy...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: This is just the beginning. And now Obadiah shuts the hatch and tumbles away. He -- Plunges down through the ARK’s silo -- splashes into the plasma which HISSES and swallows him up. Tony remains, shutting his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper rises, staring at the bubbling plasma. Not sure wh fell in there. She runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony frozen in his dead suit. He’s not moving. Two flashlights cut the darkness and Tony bats his eyes to se Rhodey and Pepper picking their way towards him.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 110-113.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 181
dialogues.text: Tony and Pepper walk along the hallway. Pepper shoves a written statement into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Here, your alibi. You were on your yacht. I’ve got port papers that put you in Avalon all night, and sworn statements from fifty of your guests.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Maybe it was just the two of us. On the yacht, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Focus, please. Tony grabs an L.A. Times from the pile of papers in her a glances at the headline: “WHO IS THE IRON MAN?” A grainy newspaper photo of the iron battle at Stark Industries.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: “Iron Man”. Not technically accurate, since it’s mostly carbon- fiber and ceramic. But I like the ring of it. “Iron Man”... They turn a corner. Tony suddenly stops. Meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know...that night at the concert hall. Do you ever think about it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT.  SALMON #2 XX/XX/07 111.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a moment there is nothing else in the world but the t of them. Then, with a tinge of sadness--

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about, Mr. Stark. She brings her hands up and fixes his unruly tie knot. Al business.

dialogues.speaker: PEPPER
dialogues.text: Will that be all, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That will be all Miss Potts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhodey is in mid-speech, in front of assembled reporters.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: --I can confirm that a series of military test-prototypes were involved in the incident at Stark Industries last night. I can also confirm that there was, for a brief time, the danger of an Ark Reactor “incident”, which was rectified without injury to the public -- and all power outages have been restored. Here now, to answer a few brief questions, is Tony Stark. Tony walks out. Takes the podium. Puts a hand up to silen the bubbling questions.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I’ve seen the papers. I’ve heard the reports. That’s why I want to put an end to all this wild speculation. The truth is-- He looks to Rhodey. To Pepper. To the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I am Iron Man. The Reporters erupt in a CACOPHONY-- We end on Tony’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SALMON
dialogues.text: INT. TONY’S LAB - MONTHS LATER - NIGHT 112. 183 Tony and Rhodey stare at a screen as the War Machine suit being designed.

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Good. And I want a Gatling gun on the right shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: --and a rocket launcher on the left? Where are you going to store all that ammo?

dialogues.speaker: RHODEY
dialogues.text: Who’s suit is this anyway? (then) And do it in silver and black, would you? © 2007 MARVEL STUDIOS, INC. NO DUPLICATION WITHOUT MARVEL’S WRITTEN CONSENT. 184
